commit_message:
Add option to disable helm.sh/hook annotations

Adding a helm3_hook in values.yaml file in case hooks needs
to be disabled (e.g. on Helm v2).

Signed-off-by: Thiago Brito <thiago.brito@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I1c03ea9ee88d1306283ce577b100c9864bec5d1b

commit_message:
Fix the functional tests

We somehow manage to merge a patch that breaks them. Import the required
code from change Ibb8c4676f653c36978bd0c9815ddf7eb80fa8670.

Make sure we run functional tests on ironicclient/tests changes.

Change-Id: I94e2b3d9ae669f2522f42879dd3ee3bd78b73c77
Co-Authored-By: Kyrylo Romanenko <kromanenko@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit ac718d5902f69e9324508de14c04d3037bb5e4fa)

commit_message:
Drop unused requirements

We don't actually use anyjson, eventlet or iso8601. Let's drop these
explicit requirements. anyjson hasn't been updated since 2012 and is
starting to fail with newer setuptools.

Change-Id: Iaa7c43e78c881fe3931a6bcf7ebe2a5487c3cd6d

commit_message:
Align swtpm packages for nova-libvirt/compute

Both containers require swtpm/tools and trousers packages installed.
Also add tss user/group.

Closes-bug: #1901530

Change-Id: Id5b83ad4e5a4e223f43adac95d0079d5cdcc2749
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2021-09-30 12:28:30.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly define engine runtime in containers.conf

We should not let the runtime container be decided by what rpms
are installed in the system. Let's specify this:
- runc on centos/rhel 8
- crun on centos/rhel 9

commit_message:
Explicitly define engine runtime in containers.conf

We should not let the runtime container be decided by what rpms
are installed in the system. Let's specify this:
- runc on centos/rhel 8
- crun on centos/rhel 9

NB: Slight context diff conflicts

Closes-Bug: #1945521
Change-Id: I1eb52bc4d6a07be1e25f33aad1fbedae70050a3a

commit_message:
Revert "Allow LVM filter to work when either allowlist or denylist are empty"

This reverts commit d76447936a571779beb2e428442a2f9539b8d39d.

Reason for revert: Reverting as per the issues reported on scenario001/002

/var/run being a symlink to /run, I have some doubts.... but... well. containers? 😄"}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-03 08:37:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> > the job is fine, so i be it's related to this patch. I bet there is an order problem with changing this as it can't stop the previous one and it loses it's mind
> 
> /var/run being a symlink to /run, I have some doubts.... but... well. containers? 😄

The container itself has apparently a ConmonPidFile option:
"ConmonPidFile": "/var/run/memcached.pid" (from `podman inspect memcached')

This is set here:
tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/tripleo_container_manage.py

Soooo... yeah. commit_message:
Systemd PIDFile needs to be in /run not in /var/run

Otherwise (in CentOS 9) we get the following warning:
  systemd[1]: /etc/systemd/system/tripleo_cinder_api.service:14: PIDFile=references a path below legacy directory /var/run/, updating
  /var/run/cinder_api.pid → /run/cinder_api.pid; please update the unit file accordingly.

Tested on CentOS 9 Stream env and we no longer get the warnings and the
services are still up and working correctly:
[root@undercloud-0 ~]# journalctl |grep PIDFile |grep tripleo
[root@undercloud-0 ~]#

Closes-Bug: #1942297

Change-Id: Ifca971e14abb184c4b7b8a0d004e8c2fbd0ecb68

commit_message:
tripleo-kernel: fixing naming of workload protection

A valid concern was raised post-merge about readability of the workload
protection function in kernelargs. Since this is an internal variable,
it shouldn't be prefixed with tripleo_kernel.

We also don't need to define the defer_reboot variable.

Change-Id: Ic93ce6fafc7a0dc3eeaa8e5cf566ab351b171385

commit_message:
Remove chrony role from kolla

chrony is not supported in Xena cycle, remove it from kolla

Moved tasks from chrony role to chrony-cleanup.yml playbook to avoid a
vestigial chrony role.

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

commit_message:
Fix delegate_to to use group rather then undercloud

Using delegate_to: undercloud relies on the director host name
being "undercloud". We should instead delegate to the first
host in the "Undercloud" group.

Backport notes:
- This change includes the following two files.

  deployment/tripleo-packages/tripleo-packages-baremetal-puppet.yaml
  deployment/keystone/keystone-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: I3560d27deb316100c3c4bf70c609c7367192d44a
(cherry picked from commit d346aa94bdc30aa89d61f49d81cfea42a197d4a7)

commit_message:
Fix delegate_to to use group rather then undercloud

Using delegate_to: undercloud relies on the director host name
being "undercloud". We should instead delegate to the first
host in the "Undercloud" group.

Change-Id: I3560d27deb316100c3c4bf70c609c7367192d44a
(cherry picked from commit d346aa94bdc30aa89d61f49d81cfea42a197d4a7)

commit_message:
Fix trove guest agent logrotate

* The logrotate file owner should be root
* Log file path is /var/log/trove/trove-guestagent.log

commit_message:
Avoid the use of --force in groupadd

According to the man page, --force may ignore --gid and this is
not what we want.
With our ID system it is almost impossible that we hit this issue
but better be safe than sorry. ;-)

Change-Id: I359982ddd144e07f8296b384638cf0b5331e495c

commit_message:
Replace deprecated assertDictContainsSubset

The method is deprecated since Python 3.2[1] and shows the following
DeprecationWarning.

/usr/lib/python3.9/unittest/case.py:1134: DeprecationWarning:
assertDictContainsSubset is deprecated
  warnings.warn('assertDictContainsSubset is deprecated',

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.2.html#unittest

Closes-Bug: #1938103
Change-Id: I2372c6f1c748a5cb1c3fcf0566684f49bc5ef715

commit_message:
Update constraint for docker to 5.0.2

Docker 5.0.1 broken Zun's gate due to issue [1]. This commit
bumps docker to 5.0.2 to address this problem.

NOTE: please merge this patch before cutting the X branch
since the change needs to go to X release.

[1] https://github.com/docker/docker-py/issues/2885

Change-Id: I0161b162b6c99c6ef4990b8496cc41ab5661b1c0

commit_message:
Use Docker healthchecks for memcached services

This change enables the use of Docker healthchecks for memcached services.
Implements: blueprint container-health-check

Change-Id: I571e6d6cac634fd86429e12b946d6f7b4a2ab02c

commit_message:
Removed default policy from horizon chart

The policy document and policy documents in the code are conflicting and creating strange issue. As the policy for nova, neutron, keystone, glance and cinder are available in horizon code, they have been removed from the chart values file.

Change-Id: I78b487c11d3d018b18ce823ffd9d8b8940dfa575

commit_message:
rephrasing config description for num_pcie_ports in libvirt

With the current phrasing, one can assume that this would be the
absolute number of PCIe ports attached to an instance but in fact, this
number is increased by 1 as per this [1]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L6536-L6541

Change-Id: I6573b1b7911c91944f1545e3a6b8c4ef4788ecfe

subject: Deprecate CORS support
messages:
[{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-08-26 23:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-27 03:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Could you help me why this should be deprecated ?
I was looking at the lastest ironic code but could not find anything explaining this feature is deprecated in ironic.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-08-27 14:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> Could you help me why this should be deprecated ?
> I was looking at the lastest ironic code but could not find anything explaining this feature is deprecated in ironic.

I guess one needs to understand the history behind CORS.

CORS support was developed as a mechanism to help enable what was functionally cross-site java script scripting acceptability to set the appropriate headers so browsers would allow the cross-site scripting to occur.

This was part of the "support javascript UI" efforts that occured ~6 years ago with the hope of improving the interaction and replacing horizon. Realistically, nobody should be setting these *unless* they are actually using them. And if they are actually using them, it would be good for the community to know because AFAIK, this is entirely unused and the only thing that leveraged it with Ironic was ironic-webclient which was long ago deprecated and removed as a sub-project.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-08-27 14:09:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Additionally, if my team is going to "own" puppet-ironic. We're only going to support known/viable/proper use cases which make sense, and continuing to support a CORS configuration pass-through without justification doesn't really make sense.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-27 14:28:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Additionally, if my team is going to "own" puppet-ironic. We're only going to support known/viable/proper use cases which make sense, and continuing to support a CORS configuration pass-through without justification doesn't really make sense.

I'm seriously concerned that you are trying to forcefully apply our downstream policy. It doesn't make sense you drop any feature Red Hat doesn't support. This is community project owned by Puppet OpenStack project which is part of OpenStack community. It doesn't make sense that we bring support policy of our own product here.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-27 14:32:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Of cause I totally agree if the ironic community is willing to drop the feature. puppet-ironic  provides an method to deploy and configure ironic and ironic-inspector, and it should align with ironic. As long as the feature is implemented in ironic itself and not deprecated/removed, there is no clear reason that we drop the feature from the puppet module.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-08-27 15:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > Could you help me why this should be deprecated ?
> > I was looking at the lastest ironic code but could not find anything explaining this feature is deprecated in ironic.
> 
> I guess one needs to understand the history behind CORS.
> 
> CORS support was developed as a mechanism to help enable what was functionally cross-site java script scripting acceptability to set the appropriate headers so browsers would allow the cross-site scripting to occur.
> 
> This was part of the "support javascript UI" efforts that occured ~6 years ago with the hope of improving the interaction and replacing horizon. Realistically, nobody should be setting these *unless* they are actually using them. And if they are actually using them, it would be good for the community to know because AFAIK, this is entirely unused and the only thing that leveraged it with Ironic was ironic-webclient which was long ago deprecated and removed as a sub-project.

To remove something like this that is universal across all the projects, this would likely need higher visibility at the TC level because we shouldn't have inconsistencies across projects.  We'd only remove this from puppet-ironic if it's dropped from ironic proper and oslo realistically'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-08-28 00:29:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > > 
> > > Could you help me why this should be deprecated ?
> > > I was looking at the lastest ironic code but could not find anything explaining this feature is deprecated in ironic.
> > 
> > I guess one needs to understand the history behind CORS.
> > 
> > CORS support was developed as a mechanism to help enable what was functionally cross-site java script scripting acceptability to set the appropriate headers so browsers would allow the cross-site scripting to occur.
> > 
> > This was part of the "support javascript UI" efforts that occured ~6 years ago with the hope of improving the interaction and replacing horizon. Realistically, nobody should be setting these *unless* they are actually using them. And if they are actually using them, it would be good for the community to know because AFAIK, this is entirely unused and the only thing that leveraged it with Ironic was ironic-webclient which was long ago deprecated and removed as a sub-project.
> 
> To remove something like this that is universal across all the projects, this would likely need higher visibility at the TC level because we shouldn't have inconsistencies across projects.  We'd only remove this from puppet-ironic if it's dropped from ironic proper and oslo realistically

To my point, we cannot support everything. Even with my community hat on, I don't see sense in supporting CORS at the ironic project level unless someone is asking. There is no standing mandate, nor do I remember there ever being one for all project to support CORS. I remember Michael Krotscheck being very happy after getting patches merged in multiple projects after Monty Taylor sent him on a mission to make the API's javascript friendly.

And to be totally honest, a project level decision is not the TC's call. If the TC wants to mandate CORS without an actual user, that is it's own mistake to make.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-30 13:38:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not in the position to decide direction of Ironic, but in my personal opinion keeping CORS would not require a huge effort while it provides some benefit to users.

Currently implementation of CORS belongs to oslo.middleware and ironic is just putting the middleware in API pipeline. There is no own logic maintained in ironic repos. Just keeping the middleware in pipeline is all what Ironic is responsible to. It is not the scope of Ironic project(or any other service projects) to test details of oslo_middleware functionality, IMO.

On the other hand CORS has been introduced to almost all core OpenStack projects. I don't have enough background to determine it's useful or useless, but iiuc the feature is still valid when an own GUI is implemented. Also, CORS is considered to be a basic feature and having inconsistent implementation status could be very confusing to users."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-08-30 14:01:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Config options are cheap to support in puppet because they don't require attention unless removed from the upstream project.  cors is configurable on every service so I disagree on the removal of this unless there's a push to drop it out of oslo.

What isn't cheap to maintain is logic we handle in puppet because end service requires weird setup.  e.g. bifrost is a good candidate for dropping because we don't test it anywhere and it's just doing git setup (Which puppet is not a good tool for).  In this module, most classes are straight forward config setting. Things like bifrost and pxe are the exceptions.

Puppet OpenStack is an upstream project who's goal is to provide tooling to configure all the thing the upstream project allows to be configured. It's a building block for operators deployments and we have tried really hard not to be as opinionated as possible over the years to allow end users to configure the services as they need."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-08-31 12:06:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I care less what puppet-ironic supports, but I'd object to removing CORS from Ironic. People do make all sorts of downstream dashboards."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-09-30 17:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-26 23:27:11.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate CORS support

Change-Id: Ie029c78af442f4c8e0e3d638f7008932c9da9869
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate CORS support

Change-Id: Ie029c78af442f4c8e0e3d638f7008932c9da9869

stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I90013a56029ff70d0112b56efd32c1d0a5a6f0e0

commit_message:
[DVR] Set arp entries only for single IPs given as allowed addr pair

In allowed address pairs of the port there can be given not single IP
address but whole CIDR. In such case ARP entries for IPs from such
cidr will not be added in the DVR router namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1934912
Change-Id: I7bdefea943379125f93b116bb899446b874d9505
(cherry picked from commit 19375b3e78ad6b635793b716e5ecabd53dc73a76)

commit_message:
[DVR] Set arp entries only for single IPs given as allowed addr pair

In allowed address pairs of the port there can be given not single IP
address but whole CIDR. In such case ARP entries for IPs from such
cidr will not be added in the DVR router namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1934912
Change-Id: I7bdefea943379125f93b116bb899446b874d9505
(cherry picked from commit 19375b3e78ad6b635793b716e5ecabd53dc73a76)

commit_message:
Add Tempest gate job for stable/xena

Now we have stable/xena branch ready for devstack
and so does for all service projects.

This commit adds the Tempest testing for stable/xena
by adding new jobs running on stable/xena version of
openstack.

Change-Id: If6f188aebe48f17d8a343c958cdeb5507421a40b

commit_message:
Add support for Ceph RadosGW integration

* Register Swift-compatible endpoints in Keystone
* Load balance across RadosGW API servers using HAProxy

The support is exercised in the cephadm CI jobs, but since RGW is
not currently enabled via cephadm, it is not yet tested.

https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/radosgw/keystone/

Implements: blueprint ceph-rgw

Change-Id: I891c3ed4ed93512607afe65a42dd99596fd4dbf9

In allowed address pairs of the port there can be given not single IP
address but whole CIDR. In such case ARP entries for IPs from such
cidr will not be added in the DVR router namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1934912
Change-Id: I7bdefea943379125f93b116bb899446b874d9505
(cherry picked from commit 19375b3e78ad6b635793b716e5ecabd53dc73a76)
'}]
commit_message:
[DVR] Set arp entries only for single IPs given as allowed addr pair

In allowed address pairs of the port there can be given not single IP
address but whole CIDR. In such case ARP entries for IPs from such
cidr will not be added in the DVR router namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1934912
Change-Id: I7bdefea943379125f93b116bb899446b874d9505
(cherry picked from commit 19375b3e78ad6b635793b716e5ecabd53dc73a76)

commit_message:
[stable/xena] Drop -master jobs

As listed in release steps, we should drop these jobs from stable
branches as they only make sense in master

Also update tripleo jobs to run on stable branch (master configuration
file has a branches override, see LP#1923201)

Change-Id: I603e40d2b7fab1c604cf7ebcabf9326e878f6a71

commit_message:
[DNM] Make ingress use service certificates

If cert-manager annotations are present in ingress, ingress-shim in
cert-manager automatically generated certificates for ingress. The
validity for these is only 90 days and currently there is no way to
customize this validity until the next cert-manager release 1.2.
Hence making ingress use the serive certificates instead of generating
new ones.

Change-Id: I7008cb328e60e5e48070e7cfb511a4d9f31ec744

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Implementation of centralized pre-wipe test

Rev.1 12.09.2020. Current status: work in progress

The osd_disk_prepare function code is split into
two parts: _init-bluestore-with-cephvolume.sh.tpl contains
the part of code related to the bluestore initialization,
_init-filestore-with-cephvolume.sh.tpl contains the code
related to filestore, respectively.

Change-Id: I6210576910d86c1b2e1f09d630ddb2d19712f4d6

commit_message:
Enable tls in check and gate pipelines for cinder and compute kit

- Switches compute kit jobs to ubuntu-bionic-single-expanded nodeset
and enables TLS in both cinder and compute-kit.
- AIO TLS is removed from gate pipeline.

Dependes-On: https://review.opendev.org/752970/
Change-Id: I982b36711b086df1682124ebd965893cc2dad5ad
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

commit_message:
Add NUMATopologyFilter in case of dpdk

According to openstack documentation for hugepages
flavor it is required to add NUMATopologyFilter. So
I added this filter to default ones and created dpdk.yaml
in values_overrides for dpdk case.

Change-Id: Icd93827d0f12946ebf5d1964f0941f3c2f56e78f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-21 19:35:33.000000000', 'message': '[ceph] Fixed a bug in custom storage classes definition

The original code overrides the list of monitors with ceph monitors defined
in [global] section of ceph.conf even if monitors are explicitly enlisted
in storage class parameters. This allows to use the only one ceph cluster with
all storage classes.

Patch set fixes this issue by using the monitors from [global] section of
ceph.conf as a 'default' value, only if the 'monitors:' parameter is not explicitly
set in the storage class definition.

Ex.
      storageclass:
        rbd:
          provision_storage_class: true
          provisioner: "ceph.com/rbd"
          metadata:
            default_storage_class: true
            name: general
          parameters:
            pool: rbd
<...>

In this case is used the monitor list from [global].

      storageclass:
        rbd-custom:
          provision_storage_class: true
          provisioner: "ceph.com/rbd"
          metadata:
            default_storage_class: true
            name: rbd-custom
          parameters:
            monitors: ceph-mon.cluster.localdomain:6798
            pool: rbd
<...>
In this case the value from storage class will be used.

Change-Id: Idcd0c3df849c3a7e5fc8853ecbb932e1626baffc
'}, {'created': '2020-09-22 15:19:14.000000000', 'message': '[ceph] Fixed a bug in custom storage classes definition

The original code overrides the list of monitors with ceph monitors defined
in [global] section of ceph.conf even if monitors are explicitly enlisted
in storage class parameters. This allows to use the only one ceph cluster with
all storage classes.

ceph.conf as a 'default' value, only if the 'monitors:' parameter is not explicitly
set in the storage class definition.

Ex.

        rbd:
          provision_storage_class: true
          provisioner: "ceph.com/rbd"
          metadata:
            default_storage_class: true
            name: general
          parameters:
            pool: rbd
<...>

In this case is used the monitor list from [global].

      storageclass:
        rbd-custom:
          provision_storage_class: true
          provisioner: "ceph.com/rbd"
          metadata:
            default_storage_class: true
            name: rbd-custom
          parameters:
            monitors: ceph-mon.cluster.localdomain:6798
            pool: rbd
<...>
In this case the value from storage class will be used.

Change-Id: Idcd0c3df849c3a7e5fc8853ecbb932e1626baffc

commit_message:
[ceph] Fixed a bug in custom storage classes definition

The original code overrides the list of monitors with ceph monitors defined
in [global] section of ceph.conf even if monitors are explicitly enlisted
in storage class parameters. This allows to use the only one ceph cluster with
all storage classes.

Patch set fixes this issue by using the monitors from [global] section of
ceph.conf as a 'default' value, only if the 'monitors:' parameter is not explicitly
set in the storage class definition.

Ex.
      storageclass:
        rbd:
          provision_storage_class: true
          provisioner: "ceph.com/rbd"
          metadata:
            default_storage_class: true
            name: general
          parameters:
            pool: rbd
<...>

In this case is used the monitor list from [global].

      storageclass:
        rbd-custom:
          provision_storage_class: true
          provisioner: "ceph.com/rbd"
          metadata:
            default_storage_class: true
            name: rbd-custom
          parameters:
            monitors: ceph-mon.cluster.localdomain:6798
            pool: rbd
<...>
In this case the value from storage class will be used.

Change-Id: Idcd0c3df849c3a7e5fc8853ecbb932e1626baffc

'}, {'created': '2020-10-07 23:24:33.000000000', 'message': '[ceph-client] This patch set fixes several issues and extends the
functionality for the function wait_for_pgs()

The original version of the function can fail if the Ceph cluster is in
is doing a rebalance or simply working under high load, being in fact
absolutely healthy. However, the deployment may fail because not all PGs
are in active state at the time of check.
The cluster definitely will do a rebalance if the autoscaling gets 
triggered for some reason. Those is expected Ceph behavior, but
can make the deployment fail.

To prevent these types of false negatives, the wait_for_pgs() function
was significantly improved and now monitors two different sets of states
- critical and acceptable.

Both list for critical and acceptable PGs states are located in
values.yaml and could be configured by a customer.
The wait_while_autoscaling() function was
added to the patch set to exclude possible autoscaling interference with
the PGs status check.

Also the service template joinListWithSeparator was added to the 
[helm-toolkit]. This template alows to convert a yaml list into
a separated string with given eliminator. Below is an example of use.

Example of use:
--------------
values: |
  test:
    - foo
    - bar
usage: |
  {{ tuple "&" .Values.test | include "helm-toolkit.utils.joinListWithSeparator" }}
return: |
  foo&bar

Change-Id: I26b8bb5eeaaf23c076b954807a11425db69d1dc3

commit_message:
[ceph-client] This patch set fixes several issues and
extends the functionality for the function wait_for_pgs()

The original version of the function can fail if
the Ceph cluster is doing a rebalance or simply
working under high load, being in fact absolutely healthy.
However, the deployment may fail because not all PGs
are in active state at the time of check.
The cluster definitely will do a rebalance if 
the autoscaling gets triggered for some reason.
This is expected Ceph behavior, but can make the
deployment fail.

To prevent these types of false negatives,
the wait_for_pgs() function was significantly
improved and now monitors two different sets of
states - critical and acceptable.

Both lists for critical and acceptable PGs states
are located in values.yaml and could be configured
by a customer.
The wait_while_autoscaling() function was added
to the patch set to exclude possible autoscaling
interference with the PGs status check.

Also the service template joinListWithSeparator was
added to the [helm-toolkit]. This template alows
converting a yaml list into a separated string with
given eliminator. Below is an example of use.

Example of use:
--------------
values: |
  test:
    - foo
    - bar
usage: |
  {{ tuple "&" .Values.test | include "helm-toolkit.utils.joinListWithSeparator" }}
return: |
  foo&bar

Change-Id: I26b8bb5eeaaf23c076b954807a11425db69d1dc3

commit_message:
[WIP] Add "TMOUT" parameter for pods in the openstack namespace

Include "TMOUT" parameter to automatically log users out of bash
sessions after a period of inactivity.

Change-Id: I72695c3ebd69173382849055cd68d520b2d9af4d

commit_message:
Prevent errors in get_active_endpoint function

Sometimes "endpoints_dict" var can be evaluated to None
resulting in "TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable"
error. This patch catches the exception while getting
list of endpoints and checks the value of
endpoints_dict.  Also the amount of active endpoints is being logged
for debug purposes.

Change-Id: Id91ed601bfa091a86fc2b330ef85ee3fbd42ceac

commit_message:
[ceph] be more paranoid in scripts about uninitialized variables

looking at logs it seems some scripts run in certain ways by accident
because of use of uninitialized variables

start looking at what simple things we can do to catch some of this

Change-Id: I14cc5a8ef9256e729f70daa69620401500eac6f9

commit_message:
heat: fix auth_uri setting

auth_uri should really be pointing at the _public_ endpoint
for Keystone, not the internal one as per the documentation.

This is important to get a successful Magnum cluster to deploy.

Change-Id: If0807fbe1e3c9076abc93ff0bae0283cdc5bf96e

commit_message:
Dep's should be restricted by tox-constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs which may
not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be
restricted by respective version's tox-constraints.txt

Change-Id: Ic9fa7a042d35e2f741eaf64d75759b7acd31da9b

[{'created': '2020-11-17 14:42:48.000000000', 'message': "magnum: Resolve missing configurations

This patch adds a few missing configurations in order to make the latest
release of Magnum work with OpenStack Helm.  The `keystone_auth` section
is necessary for the 'communication' across services, the auth_uri
(deperecated) and the www_authenticate_uri should be properly set to the
public endpoint (so that services can talk to Magnum cleanly) and the
regions for the clients should match the one that Magnum is running in
within a multi-region environment to avoid cross-region requests when
they are not requested.

Change-Id: Ib22375aa818e7954f97f7623300642b18e697519
"}, {'created': '2020-11-17 15:01:34.000000000', 'message': "magnum: Resolve missing configurations

This patch adds a few missing configurations in order to make the latest
release of Magnum work with OpenStack Helm.  The `keystone_auth` section
is necessary for the 'communication' across services, the auth_uri
(deperecated) and the www_authenticate_uri should be properly set to the
public endpoint (so that services can talk to Magnum cleanly) and the
regions for the clients should match the one that Magnum is running in
within a multi-region environment to avoid cross-region requests when
they are not requested.

It also fixes magnum-conductor to allow it to rollout on configuration
changes.

Change-Id: Ib22375aa818e7954f97f7623300642b18e697519
"}]
commit_message:
magnum: Resolve missing configurations

This patch adds a few missing configurations in order to make the latest
release of Magnum work with OpenStack Helm.  The `keystone_auth` section
is necessary for the 'communication' across services, the auth_uri
(deperecated) and the www_authenticate_uri should be properly set to the
public endpoint (so that services can talk to Magnum cleanly) and the
regions for the clients should match the one that Magnum is running in
within a multi-region environment to avoid cross-region requests when
they are not requested.

It also fixes magnum-conductor to allow it to rollout on configuration
changes.

Change-Id: Ib22375aa818e7954f97f7623300642b18e697519

commit_message:
Moving job_db_sync and job_ks_endpoints to dynamic deps

The patch moves job_db_sync and job_ks_endpoints from static to
dynamic dependencies to make it possible to disable these manifests.

Change-Id: Ib436fcc5fe76e6d2a32a83dfcaa4b6399acbee6a

commit_message:
Moving jobs definitions from static to dynamic deps

The patch adds ability to move a definition from static to dynamic
section because of the fact that in some cases users and
credentials for OpenStack services had been created in RabbitMQ
before deployment of the OpepnStack chart for an service. Values is going
to have the below structure. cinder-rabbit-init, job_storage_init and
job_backup_storage_init  could be moved from static to dynamic section.
Example structure is below:

values:
  dependencies:
    dynamic:
      job_rabbit_init:
        api:
          jobs:
            - cinder-rabbit-init

Change-Id: I645371522ea3063f0657e77a40a90a0c518f7b8e

messages: [{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-11-12 20:27:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-09-30 16:07:35.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nAbandoning since there hasn't been any recent activity, if anyone wants to continue this work, please feel free to restore this or create a new change."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-12 20:27:15.000000000', 'message': 'keystone: do not delete secrets on deploy

The default hook-delete-policy for Helm is before-hook-creation[1]
which corresponds to "Delete the previous resource before a new hook
is launched (default)".

This will result in the secret being wiped on every deploy, the solution
in here is to switch it to `hook-failed` which maps to "Delete the
resource if the hook failed during execution" -- however, given that
this is a secret, it will never 'fail', keeping that resource untouched.

[1]: https://helm.sh/docs/topics/charts_hooks/#hook-deletion-policies

Change-Id: Id6a8115e52a08f0618d9252b3264999272272725
'}]
commit_message:
keystone: do not delete secrets on deploy

The default hook-delete-policy for Helm is before-hook-creation[1]
which corresponds to "Delete the previous resource before a new hook
is launched (default)".

This will result in the secret being wiped on every deploy, the solution
in here is to switch it to `hook-failed` which maps to "Delete the
resource if the hook failed during execution" -- however, given that
this is a secret, it will never 'fail', keeping that resource untouched.

[1]: https://helm.sh/docs/topics/charts_hooks/#hook-deletion-policies

Change-Id: Id6a8115e52a08f0618d9252b3264999272272725

subject: Ceph-rgw, if gc takes too long for cleanup. You can try this as override values as ceph parameters commented.

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2020-07-11 01:00:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-07-11 02:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-07-11 02:54:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-07-11 03:05:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-07-15 03:34:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-07-15 03:35:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Andrii Ostapenko or some, could you please take a look.'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-07-15 03:57:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

correction: s/some/someone/'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2020-07-15 19:00:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

how is this filling up so quickly

can you explain the numbers perhaps?'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-07-16 05:30:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Ceph manages the backend persistent through storage pools and each pool will have 3 replicas by default:

- It creates storage pools and manages quota on them.
- For common services like Rabbitmq, Mariadb it needs persistent storage coming from rbd(block device) pool.
- Then glance uses rgw(object store) pool.
- As an example, if we have development cluster with lets say 3 node. 
  It creates ceph cluster, taking out 10Gb from each node. Adding a total of 30Gb ceph managed storage.
  Now in that 30Gb, usabe is less than 10Gb .. because of 3 replicas and metadata.
  This 10Gb needs to be allocated across across services through storage pools, especially if you have mariab 
  cluster and more rabbitmq instances. The space requirement gets multiplied.
- In such scenario, where storage management becomes important.
  Ceph rgw/glance object store cleaup, parameters will help. Where it runs garbase collector over time to cleanup.
  The default is 2hrs, that means even if i delete 2gb image to make space. ceph gc will take 2hrs to cleanup.
  The values proposed will enable gc to run in 10mins and space can be claimed.
  Reference to ceph parameters proposed: https://docs.ceph.com/docs/nautilus/radosgw/config-ref/
  
Here are related parameters coming from openstack-helm-infra charts:
ceph-osd/values.yaml
ceph-client/values.yaml
ceph-rgw/values.yaml'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2020-07-17 09:02:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

thanks for the details explanation but i'm still struggling to see how 2GB or even 10GB matters

these are relatively small amount of space by modern standards"}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-07-17 11:56:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Okay, how about large cleanup of images in 100's Gb.
In a time, when space used in file system is over 90% ?
Will have to wait for 2hours for gc to start, by then increasing space might bring down ceph cluster?. 
Without quotas set for rbd, rgw .. all the persistent storage dependent services like Mariadb, Rabbitmq, will be competing for common space.

This was the scenario, where had to tweak these parameters to get over it.
Dev clusters with default install used to crash every 2 to 3 days, so monitoring ceph storage, pool quota, adjusting these ceph gc parameters helped."}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-07-25 01:31:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-07-25 05:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Not sure, if this verification failure because of my change.
Also, it passed before too.

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/75d3a6a383ea4ecf935218f66101d88d

ldap-bootstrap-7hqrp                                0/1     CrashLoopBackOff   7          15m   192.168.120.113   minikube   <none>           <none>'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-07-26 23:19:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2020-08-10 21:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-08-13 04:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 32260, 'date': '2020-08-13 17:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 32260, 'date': '2020-08-13 18:05:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 32260, 'date': '2020-08-13 18:10:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Have these change been tested in a site to be sure there are no adverse effects?'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2020-08-14 03:42:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

anyone on the storage team want to chime in?'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-08-14 04:07:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

It reduces cleanup/gc interval from 2 hours to 10 mins once something is cleaned ceph-rgw object store.'}, {'account_id': 29974, 'date': '2020-08-14 14:34:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Functionally this looks fine from a Ceph perspective. Has any assessment been made regarding the impact RGW garbage collection has on Ceph performance? This change increases the frequency of that garbage collection significantly and will have some level of negative impact on performance.

Also, have alternative strategies like erasure coding been considered? This is a higher-level change, but in this case I would expect EC to have less impact on performance than this increase in GC frequency. EC can reduce the data footprint and slow this problem so GC can run effectively while running less frequently.'}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2020-08-14 16:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> Functionally this looks fine from a Ceph perspective. Has any
 > assessment been made regarding the impact RGW garbage collection
 > has on Ceph performance? This change increases the frequency of
 > that garbage collection significantly and will have some level of
 > negative impact on performance.
 > 
 > Also, have alternative strategies like erasure coding been
 > considered? This is a higher-level change, but in this case I would
 > expect EC to have less impact on performance than this increase in
 > GC frequency. EC can reduce the data footprint and slow this
 > problem so GC can run effectively while running less frequently.

yes , we could always add these values as overrides if a deployment experiencing the issues.i would  suggest to comment out these values and leave a NOTE to instruct when to enable them .'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2020-09-21 04:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-09-29 11:20:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 18250, 'date': '2020-09-29 14:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17119, 'date': '2020-10-01 22:14:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-11-08 09:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-11-08 09:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Thanks to comments from Stephen Taylor, chinasubbareddy mallavarapu .. this can go in comments.
So updaing in comments'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-11-08 09:49:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-11-08 09:50:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2020-11-08 11:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: -Code-Review

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-09 14:53:32.000000000', 'message': 'Using ceph-rgw glance store takes too long to cleanup, even after deleting.
The default is 2hours and that needs to be adjusted otherwise, this image store fills up quickly.
Also note that, ceph makes three copies per pool by default.

Having these suggested values will cleanup in 5 to 10mins as compares to 2 hours.

Reference: https://docs.ceph.com/docs/nautilus/radosgw/config-ref/

rgw gc obj min wait

Description
The minimum wait time before the object may be removed and handled by garbage collection processing.

Type
Integer

Default
2 * 3600

Change-Id: Iddb981c602b70f4433336b8a6dae7cb7b8083839
'}, {'created': '2020-07-11 02:51:44.000000000', 'message': 'Ceph-rgw gc takes too long for cleanup.

The default ceph-rgw object store gc runs every two hours.
Thats too long, considering new OS glance images can fillup
space in two hours. Also ceph by default makes makes
three copies and that adds up to the space consumption in
ceph-rgw pool backend.

Adding these rgw_gc parameters will help run gc to reduce
the cleaup interval. Here is the reference to ceph parameters:
https://docs.ceph.com/docs/nautilus/radosgw/config-ref/

rgw_gc_obj_min_wait: The minimum wait time before the object
may be removed and handled by garbage. Default: 2 * 3600.

rgw_gc_processor_max_time: The maximum time between the beginning
of two consecutive garbage collection processing cycles.
Default: 3600.

rgw_gc_processor_period: The cycle time for garbage collection
processing. Default: 3600.

Change-Id: Iddb981c602b70f4433336b8a6dae7cb7b8083839

commit_message:
Ceph-rgw, if gc takes too long for cleanup. You can try this
as override values as ceph parameters commented.

The default ceph-rgw object store gc runs every two hours.
Thats too long, considering new OS glance images can fillup
space in two hours. Also ceph by default makes three
copies and that adds up to the space consumption in
ceph-rgw pool backend.

Adding these rgw_gc parameters will help run gc to reduce
the cleaup interval. Here is the reference to ceph parameters:
https://docs.ceph.com/docs/nautilus/radosgw/config-ref/

rgw_gc_obj_min_wait: The minimum wait time before the object
may be removed and handled by garbage. Default: 2 * 3600.

rgw_gc_processor_max_time: The maximum time between the beginning
of two consecutive garbage collection processing cycles.
Default: 3600.

rgw_gc_processor_period: The cycle time for garbage collection
processing. Default: 3600.

Change-Id: Iddb981c602b70f4433336b8a6dae7cb7b8083839

commit_message:
[nova] Switch to helm-toolkit.utils.daemonset_overrides_root

The patch switch neutron daemonsets to use overrides daemonset_overrides_root

  values:
   overrides:
     nova_compute:
       labels:
         override::me:
           root:
             override_root_option: override_root_value
             conf:
               neutron:
                 DEFAULT:
                   foo: bar

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761028/

Change-Id: Ib7b919949e0b1625ea6ce5ad90ef2350dbdc96df

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-02 22:08:27.000000000', 'message': "[helm-toolkit] add daemonset_overrides_root function

The helm-toolkit.utils.daemonset_overrides function have some limitations:

 * it allows to override only conf values specifid in configmap-etc
 * it doesn't allow to override values for daemonsets passed via env variables
   or via damoenset definition. As result it is impossible to have mixed
   deployment when one compute is configured with dpdk while other not.
 * it is impossible to override interface names/other information stored in
   <service>-bin configmap
 * It allows to schedule on both hosts and labels, which adds some
   uncertainty

This implementation is intended to handle those limitations:

 * it allows to schedule only based on labels
 * it creates <service>-bin per daemonset override
 * it allows to override values when rendering daemonsets

 It picks data from the following structure:

 .Values:
   mychart_mydaemonset:
     labels:
       override::me:
         root:
           override_root_option: override_root_value
           conf:
             ovs_dpdk:
               enabled: true
             neutron:
               DEFAULT:
                 foo: bar

Change-Id: I133e07f759111cd8f568c49fd78ed0f7ed8435e5
"}, {'created': '2020-11-03 08:12:27.000000000', 'message': "[helm-toolkit] add daemonset_overrides_root function

Change-Id: I133e07f759111cd8f568c49fd78ed0f7ed8435e5

commit_message:
[helm-toolkit] add daemonset_overrides_root function

The helm-toolkit.utils.daemonset_overrides function have some limitations:

 * it allows to override only conf values specifid in configmap-etc
 * it doesn't allow to override values for daemonsets passed via env variables
   or via damoenset definition. As result it is impossible to have mixed
   deployment when one compute is configured with dpdk while other not.
 * it is impossible to override interface names/other information stored in
   <service>-bin configmap
 * It allows to schedule on both hosts and labels, which adds some
   uncertainty

This implementation is intended to handle those limitations:

 * it allows to schedule only based on labels
 * it creates <service>-bin per daemonset override
 * it allows to override values when rendering daemonsets

 It picks data from the following structure:

 .Values:
   overrides:
     mychart_mydaemonset:
       labels:
         override::me:
           root:
             override_root_option: override_root_value
             conf:
               ovs_dpdk:
                 enabled: true
               neutron:
                 DEFAULT:
                   foo: bar

Change-Id: I133e07f759111cd8f568c49fd78ed0f7ed8435e5

commit_message:
[Mariadb] Add role controller

This patch adds mariadb controller that is responsible to mark one
ready pod as mariadb_role: primary to forward all traffic to it.
This will allow to drop nginx ingress controller which adds extra
hops between client and server and uses heavy customized nginx templates.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752677/

Change-Id: I3b29bc2029bfd39754516e73a09e4e14c52ccc99

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-25 03:35:49.000000000', 'message': 'postgresql: Restore audit user creation capability

The postgresql chart used to create an audit user. [0]

When patroni was removed, this functionality went away. [1]

This change restores the ability to create the audit user and set its
password. This happens during pod startup, just after the admin password
is set.

0: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680081/
1: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/723053/

Change-Id: I5cd1c774e75fde5b7e3f1634c5cc6e06239b3fc8
'}]
commit_message:
postgresql: Restore audit user creation capability

The postgresql chart used to create an audit user. [0]

When patroni was removed, this functionality went away. [1]

This change restores the ability to create the audit user and set its
password. This happens during pod startup, just after the admin password
is set.

0: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680081/
1: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/723053/

Change-Id: I5cd1c774e75fde5b7e3f1634c5cc6e06239b3fc8

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-30 15:06:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add a condition for systemd service detection in monasca_setup

Skip agent service detection if only installing plugins.
This will make it possible to use monasca-setup on the environments
 where monasca-agent is not running as systemd service.
Typical usecase is running agent on kubernetes.

Change-Id: I232506e19f593b43cc011c6499242847c9bbc108
(cherry picked from commit a8be13bdeb84bd11019f8e0010985181115cc73a)
'}]
commit_message:
Add a condition for systemd service detection in monasca_setup

Skip agent service detection if only installing plugins.
This will make it possible to use monasca-setup on the environments
 where monasca-agent is not running as systemd service.
Typical usecase is running agent on kubernetes.

Change-Id: I232506e19f593b43cc011c6499242847c9bbc108
(cherry picked from commit a8be13bdeb84bd11019f8e0010985181115cc73a)

commit_message:
[Cinder] Mount rw working directory /var/lib/cinder

Mount /var/lib/cinder from host to cinder-backup, cinder-volume
container to allow store its temporary data.

commit_message:
[memcached] Enable memcached ingress-controller & ingress-error-pages

Adopt the 'active / backup' strategy of ingress in mariadb chart to solve similar bug

Change-Id: I051c60a101008f913b620fa3e91a637897bd8d1f
Closes-Bug: #1858171

commit_message:
Add registry authentication support

Add the default values for the oci_image_registry endpoint which holds
information to build the dockerconfigjson secret enabling authentication
on the registry.
A new secret is also added with a manifest to generate it.

Change-Id: I267b55d737c18c87083c23b1a740b3bb1b6b6b9d
Implements: blueprint support-oci-image-registry-with-authentication-turned-on
Depends-On: Id9fca020c351683c25ebe83d65e3da2c779bd9b6

[{'created': '2019-08-05 06:58:42.000000000', 'message': "[neutron] Add DVR support

Nodes labeled with 'dvr' will host l3 agent in dvr mode and
metadata agent. Nodes labeled with 'dvr' and 'snat' will host
l3 agent in dvr_snat mode and metadata agent.
iAdditionally on 'dvr' labeled nodes distributed routing mode
will be enabled in openvswitch agent.

commit_message:
[neutron] Add DVR support

With DVR feature enabled in neutron l3 and metadata agents
will be deployed on compute nodes.

Change-Id: Ifc8ec496e76a7163bc9c48aeb4a57a65c46fdd8a

[{'account_id': 32433, 'date': '2020-09-16 17:22:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-09-16 17:22:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 32433, 'date': '2020-09-16 17:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2020-09-17 00:36:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Run compute-kit on changes to relevant charts

This commit runs osh compute-kit job on changes to helm-toolkit,
mariadb, openvswitch, memcached, libvirt and rabbitmq charts.

Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

> could you please describe exact issue in details.

Metadata agent caches VM id by (IP, network_id) pairs. Default expiration time is 600 seconds. During that time original VM could be deleted, and new VM in same net can get same IP -> cached value will be wrong. Please let me know what exactly is not clear. [{'created': '2020-01-23 13:53:23.000000000', 'message': '[neutron] decrease cache expiration time for metadata agent

Metadata agent caches results of port queries to neutron server.
Ports are queried by IP address and network id.
Default expiration time is 600 seconds.
600 secinds is quite a long time, and IP address might be already
reused by another port/VM - this leads to issues with getting
metadata.
The patch suggests to set expiration time to 30 seconds by default.

commit_message:
[neutron] decrease cache expiration time for metadata agent

Metadata agent caches results of port queries to neutron server.
Ports are queried by IP address and network id.
Default expiration time is 600 seconds.
600 seconds is quite a long time, and IP address might be already
reused by another port/VM - this leads to issues with getting
metadata.
The patch suggests to set expiration time to 30 seconds by default.

Change-Id: I3607eeb46e2af3dcdeb92f985f7ad190f47ab486

commit_message:
Creating predefined users,perms,vhosts in rabbitMQ

The aim of the patch is to create predefined users which are
going to be used by OpenStack services or any other purposes
with their vhosts and permissions at start up stage through
defintion.json file.

Change-Id: I15f646f4f0df4e7b181aabe044a2ed8ad5fd5163

commit_message:
Cannot manage ironic nodes after re-deploying ironic chart

Ironic-conductor saves all pxe data for each ironic nodes.
Theses files are needed to manage the ironic nodes.
However ironic chart mounts this pxe directory into
an emptyDir option, therefore these pxe data would be
removed in case of re-deployment of ironic chart.
We need to have an option for saving the pxe data in a persistent.

Change-Id: Id204e46f525bcb25494bbaf6c4bb496b3cc5097f
Story: 2007751
Task: 39940

commit_message:
Add generic-health-probe to helm-toolkit

There are various of services that are checked by eestablished connections
to Rabbitmq and Database. The patch adds generic probe to perform those
checks.

Change-Id: Ic5a1017565c9e989f0f973ecb590086090abc0d9
Related-Prod: PRODX-3456

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-11 20:53:47.000000000', 'message': "Use ceph-mgr prometheus module default settings

This updates the ceph-client chart to use the default settings
for the address and port for the ceph-mgr prometheus module. As
multiple ceph-mgr replicas result in an active/standby deployment,
explicitly setting the exporter address to 0.0.0.0 results in
unexpected behavior. This is because by default, the module will
configure all prometheus module exporter's addresses to the
active mgr's hostname, which allows any queries made to standby
ceph-mgrs to be routed to the active ceph-mgr instead, resulting
in expected behavior

Change-Id: Ibf5d1d3cd276188d730392483835c85ae9a46dba
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Use ceph-mgr prometheus module default settings

This updates the ceph-client chart to use the default settings
for the address and port for the ceph-mgr prometheus module. As
multiple ceph-mgr replicas result in an active/standby deployment,
explicitly setting the exporter address to 0.0.0.0 results in
unexpected behavior. This is because by default, the module will
configure all prometheus module exporter's addresses to the
active mgr's hostname, which allows any queries made to standby
ceph-mgrs to be routed to the active ceph-mgr instead, resulting
in expected behavior

Change-Id: Ibf5d1d3cd276188d730392483835c85ae9a46dba
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-17 07:40:24.000000000', 'message': "[helm-toolkit] Add the replacement of illegal characters in _daemonset_overrides.tpl

In some scenarios, the label of node contains characters that Kubernetes resources name cannot tolerate, such as'/','_', and so on. In _ daemonset_overrides.tpl, the replacement of illegal characters has been added, that is, when rendering the metadata name of secret or daemonset, the illegal characters will be replaced with'-'.

Change-Id: If39a0909977f3bb882b2cd2f6ca4aa4c04442638
"}]
commit_message:
[helm-toolkit] Add the replacement of illegal characters in _daemonset_overrides.tpl

In some scenarios, the label of node contains characters that Kubernetes resources name cannot tolerate, such as'/','_', and so on. In _ daemonset_overrides.tpl, the replacement of illegal characters has been added, that is, when rendering the metadata name of secret or daemonset, the illegal characters will be replaced with'-'.

Change-Id: If39a0909977f3bb882b2cd2f6ca4aa4c04442638

commit_message:
[DNM] Test of using .Files.Get vs include for script assets

Right now we use include for almost all scripts and fragments, many of
which do not need gotpl mangling and would be eaiser if left naked.

Change-Id: Iaa7dab07ace8520bc9a1d603026526c871fea864

commit_message:
Pass pip index environment variables to loci build

Currently the way to pass PIP_INDEX_URL and PIP_TRUSTED_HOST is to
pass proper base image that has corresponding environment variables,
however these variables will be part of environment of resulting image.
Instead, this commit adds these vars as build args for loci Dockerfile.

Change-Id: I90c217291f8d6a5dab84a60a90e98a2e8986421c

commit_message:
Extract rendered scripts from configmap-bin.yaml

Extract scripts after configmap-bin.yaml rendering during 'tox -elint'
run to .yamllint/${CHART}/templates/bin directory for evaluation and
possible future processing.

Change-Id: I88debe46f6eaf87ef044c6a612e5c2cd29b0887d
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

[{'created': '2020-04-24 06:34:17.000000000', 'message': "Enable tty and stdin for containers in debug mode

With this commit by setting 'debug: true' in values, containers allocate
tty and stdin buffer, allowing to attach to running container and
use pdb with e.g.:

kubectl attach -nopenstack mariadb-server-0

commit_message:
Enable tty and stdin for containers in debug mode

With this commit by setting 'debug: true' in values, containers allocate
tty and stdin buffer, allowing to attach to running container and
use pdb with e.g.:

kubectl attach -nopenstack mariadb-server-0

Change-Id: I9bfebc60dfd84209d8b5680c8dd54b794eb65786

commit_message:
Checks replication status in the readiness probe.

If wsrep_ready is not ON. Then checks if the replication is in
progress and does not exit 1 if replication is in progress.

wsrep_ready = ON implies wsrep_local_state_comment = Synced
hence removed explicity check for Synced

Change-Id: If6ebc934ee31040c92ef39c0ac2f64d9060f74bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-23 17:01:06.000000000', 'message': '[mariadb] Use service IP in cluster address

It was observed that under certain circumstances
galera instances can use old IP address of the node
after pod restart. This patch changes the value of
wsrep_cluster_address variable - instead of listing
all dns names of the cluster nodes the discovery service
IP address is used. In this case cluster_node_address is set to IP
address instead of DNS name - otherwise SST method will fail.

Change-Id: I4d05309b70e0eaee7ac126b5a36f3778439b5827

commit_message:
[mariadb] Use service IP in cluster address

It was observed that under certain circumstances
galera instances can use old IP address of the node
after pod restart. This patch changes the value of
wsrep_cluster_address variable - instead of listing
all dns names of the cluster nodes the discovery service
IP address is used. In this case cluster_node_address is set to IP
address instead of DNS name - otherwise SST method will fail.

Change-Id: I4d05309b70e0eaee7ac126b5a36f3778439b5827

commit_message:
Prometheus: change nova-compute disabled alert

Previously alerts complained about disabled compute nodes.
Compute nodes can be disabled in some cloud. Instead the alert should
focus on down compute hosts.

Change-Id: I12f83004ada437a603e86364ada9b99e86368ad8

commit_message:
Add a rh-python36-mod_wsgi in bindep for rpm apache

Add apache's dependencies in bindep for ussuri openstack image.
The openstack image which is built from python3 environment needs
python3_mod_wsgi package if this image is going to install httpd/apache.
Legency mod_wsgi may not be suit for python3 environmrnt anymore.

Story: 2007671
Task: 39772

Change-Id: I5d6289b74a90204cd791907b5988cfe36e35f45d
Signed-off-by: Yu Chengde <yu.chengde@99cloud.com>

> What's the difference between "experimental" and non-voting?

experimental isn't ran on each patch change, it's manually triggered by commenting "check experimental".  So it's good for adding a job and testing/working on stability as a process of making it an normal check/gate job.'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-05-06 08:14:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Could we add this as experimental then until it's stable enough to consider voting?

To be fair, this should be now considered stable enough as to be part of the normal checks, as it also checks the rest of the components.

Work was done to get this job to full work state, so IMHO it should be set as voting from the start."}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-05-06 08:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-05-06 08:21:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9963, 'date': '2019-05-06 08:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add tempest job and gate to zuul as voting

Patches has been sent to fix the tempest job so
now that its working enable it voting for jobs and the gate

Also enable the experimental multinode-tempest job so
we can improve it in the future now that the base tempest
job is working

Change-Id: I6a02c3a348dc79dd6a579c5efa8fa8267c937156

[{'account_id': 30537, 'date': '2019-06-03 08:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-06-03 08:09:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Add glance metadefs to glance DB

To pass a specific tempest test,
glance DB should load "metadata definition service" in advance.

The specific api test is
"tempest.api.image.v2.test_images_metadefs_namespaces".

Change-Id: Id6f2a3aba2083d865bfb407ca7cfca5216c22db2

commit_message:
Dex: Initial Chart

This PS brings in a functional Dex Chart for use with
keystone. Currently due to dex limitations only web sso
is supported, future work should enable CLI use.

Change-Id: Ib1c8284a34de5a6a3638bd3756153d6e5b47af11
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

[{'created': '2021-09-29 11:55:15.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Disable libvirt debug logs

Libvirt debug logs can grow very large, particularly on Ubuntu (we have
seen up to 1.1GB). Disable libvirt debug logging using variable
nova_libvirt_logging_debug which was added to Kolla Ansible during the
Wallaby cycle (see change I90bfd1b300ad3202ea4d139fda6d6beb44c5820f) and
backported to Victoria and Ussuri.

Change-Id: Ic047e80aa382148b009b1c03581b417d17ec2598
(cherry picked from commit f09faa43d1a1d38b30967cce948af6b60c34be70)
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Disable libvirt debug logs

Libvirt debug logs can grow very large, particularly on Ubuntu (we have
seen up to 1.1GB). Disable libvirt debug logging using variable
nova_libvirt_logging_debug which was added to Kolla Ansible during the
Wallaby cycle (see change I90bfd1b300ad3202ea4d139fda6d6beb44c5820f) and
backported to Victoria and Ussuri.

Change-Id: Ic047e80aa382148b009b1c03581b417d17ec2598
(cherry picked from commit f09faa43d1a1d38b30967cce948af6b60c34be70)

Skip agent service detection if only installing plugins.
This will make it possible to use monasca-setup on the environments

Change-Id: Ide5aee0cdd65bc6954296b995e61d395be8e9603

commit_message:
Add a condition for systemd service detection in monasca_setup

Skip agent service detection if only installing plugins.
This will make it possible to use monasca-setup on the environments
 where monasca-agent is not running as systemd service.
Typical usecase is running agent on kubernetes.

Change-Id: Ide5aee0cdd65bc6954296b995e61d395be8e9603

[{'created': '2021-09-29 11:55:27.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Disable libvirt debug logs

Libvirt debug logs can grow very large, particularly on Ubuntu (we have
seen up to 1.1GB). Disable libvirt debug logging using variable
nova_libvirt_logging_debug which was added to Kolla Ansible during the
Wallaby cycle (see change I90bfd1b300ad3202ea4d139fda6d6beb44c5820f) and
backported to Victoria and Ussuri.

Change-Id: Ic047e80aa382148b009b1c03581b417d17ec2598
(cherry picked from commit f09faa43d1a1d38b30967cce948af6b60c34be70)
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Disable libvirt debug logs

Libvirt debug logs can grow very large, particularly on Ubuntu (we have
seen up to 1.1GB). Disable libvirt debug logging using variable
nova_libvirt_logging_debug which was added to Kolla Ansible during the
Wallaby cycle (see change I90bfd1b300ad3202ea4d139fda6d6beb44c5820f) and
backported to Victoria and Ussuri.

Change-Id: Ic047e80aa382148b009b1c03581b417d17ec2598
(cherry picked from commit f09faa43d1a1d38b30967cce948af6b60c34be70)

Deploy source type images by default

Source images get the most test coverage, so it makes sense to deploy
these by default.

commit_message:
Add section for 'nova-manage placement audit' tool

The 'nova-manage placement audit' tool has functionality that can
delete orphaned allocations in placement. Add a section for it in the
doc for troubleshooting orphaned allocations.

Change-Id: I697de57cf7eb43c0993af2b1f5b3f5c4395ef097

Add functional tests to reproduce the race between resize_instance()
and update_available_resources().

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-30 13:13:17.000000000', 'message': "Enable interface use in CMR contexts

In cross model relation contexts, the unit name on the consuming
side of the relation is obfuscated by Juju.  Explicitly set the
name of the unit on the relation so providing service can use
this as the key when returning a specific unit's cert and key
for TLS encryption.

Change-Id: Iae93521bc4a3d899560ac304e7b98bfd1d282709
"}]
commit_message:
Enable interface use in CMR contexts

In cross model relation contexts, the unit name on the consuming
side of the relation is obfuscated by Juju.  Explicitly set the
name of the unit on the relation so providing service can use
this as the key when returning a specific unit's cert and key
for TLS encryption.

Change-Id: Iae93521bc4a3d899560ac304e7b98bfd1d282709

commit_message:
Allow LVM filter to work when either allowlist or denylist are empty

Fixes the LVM filter task for it to build correctly formatted lists
when either one of allowlist or denylist are empty.

Change-Id: I3ebd492455462420cac2ed6b0c30d2758225abec
Closes-Bug: 1944743

Hello Przemyslaw. Once the spec [1] and the neutron-lib [2] patches were merged, I was expecting a Neutron server patch to (1) create the new DB tables, (2) create the DB models and objects and (3) modify the QoS extension to add those new rules.

I know your goal is to provide QoS packet processing info to the placement, but I think you should not start with the agent but the server code first.

Once the Neutron server side is implemented, you should also modify OpenStackDSK and OpenStack Client to add this new rule type to the CLI.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-specs/+/785236
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/800441'}, {'account_id': 33652, 'date': '2021-07-22 08:03:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
> 
> Hello Przemyslaw. Once the spec [1] and the neutron-lib [2] patches were merged, I was expecting a Neutron server patch to (1) create the new DB tables, (2) create the DB models and objects and (3) modify the QoS extension to add those new rules.
> 
> I know your goal is to provide QoS packet processing info to the placement, but I think you should not start with the agent but the server code first.
> 
> Once the Neutron server side is implemented, you should also modify OpenStackDSK and OpenStack Client to add this new rule type to the CLI.
> 
> [1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-specs/+/785236
> [2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/800441

Hi Rodolfo. Thanks for the comments.

I thought that starting with agent part would be acceptable. I wanted to provide pps info to placement as soon as possible.

I'm currently working on adding DB model & objects, and QoS extension. When I'm done with the implementation, should I rearrange order of commits in the chain so that server side can be merged first?"}, {'account_id': 33652, 'date': '2021-08-05 07:42:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-08-05 09:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-12 10:09:02.000000000', 'message': "ovs-agent: Report pkt processing info in heartbeat

OVS agent configuration is extended to support new configuration
options:
  - 'resource_provider_packet_processing_without_direction'
  - 'resource_provider_packet_processing_with_direction'
  - 'resource_provider_packet_processing_inventory_defaults'

OVS agent RPC hearthbeat now reports this information to neutron
server in 'configuration' field .

Example config:

ml2_conf.ini:
[ovs]
resource_provider_packet_processing_with_direction = :1000:1000

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/800441
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: Ief554bc445dfd93ea6995bb42b4d010674c7a091

commit_message:
ovs-agent: Report pkt processing info in heartbeat

OVS agent configuration is extended to support new configuration
options:
  - 'resource_provider_packet_processing_without_direction'
  - 'resource_provider_packet_processing_with_direction'
  - 'resource_provider_packet_processing_inventory_defaults'

OVS agent RPC hearthbeat now reports this information to neutron
server in 'configuration' field .

Example config:

ml2_conf.ini:
[ovs]
resource_provider_packet_processing_with_direction = :1000:1000

Partial-Bug: #1922237
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: Ief554bc445dfd93ea6995bb42b4d010674c7a091

commit_message:
Final RC patch for ec2-api

This creates a new RC before the final release candidate deadline to
release the latest fixes and/or translations.

Please ack with a +1, or if there is some reason to hold off, leave a -1.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 30.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 13.0.0.0rc1..183397a
183397a remove lower-constraints job. it's buggy
b281f31 Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7
e6e1ab3 update aws ec2 interface
e6f4c30 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena
0154083 update .gitreview

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic27b0b209e4a536de8e4235395bb6f679608f0e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-30 14:38:02.000000000', 'message': "Add API extenstion for QoS minimum pps rule

This patch implements support for CRUD operations for QoS minimum
packet rate. The new rule is accesible through old-style API where
policy_id has to be provided in the URI:

DELETE /qos/policies/$POLICY_ID/minimum_packet_rate_rules/$RULE_ID

or with new-style API:

DELETE /qos/minimum_packet_rate_rules/$RULE_ID

Keep in mind that new-style doesn't use 'alias_' prefix, as opposed to
other QoS rule aliases.

Placement or dataplane enforcement is not implemented yet.
New-style API is not covered with UTs.

Partial-Bug: #1922237
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802486
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802487
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: Ie994bdab62bab33737f25287e568519c782dea9a

commit_message:
Add API extension for QoS minimum pps rule

This patch implements support for CRUD operations for QoS minimum
packet rate, for example:

DELETE /qos/policies/$POLICY_ID/minimum_packet_rate_rules/$RULE_ID

Placement or dataplane enforcement is not implemented yet.

Partial-Bug: #1922237
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: Ie994bdab62bab33737f25287e568519c782dea9a

commit_message:
Restart radosgw services on upgrade

When radosgw packages are upgraded, the radosgw service needs to
be restarted by the charm. Check to see that packages were installed
on the upgrade path and if so, restart the radosgw service.

Change-Id: I61055ea4605a9a7c490c18f611d0eb583c617ce3
Closes-Bug: #1906707

commit_message:
Build source type images by default

Source images get the most test coverage, so it makes sense to build
these by default.

Change-Id: Ie10a41a94af95075a1b91feb2b74ade02b17117e

commit_message:
Fix create_notification unittest and bump lower-constraints

- The method create_notification returns an uuid string, if it isn't
mocked the 'notification's id' will be:

<MagicMock name='NotificationsRepository().create_notification()'

which can't be dump to json later.

- Bump Mako to 1.0.7 in lower-constraints.txt
- Bump decorator to 4.1.0 in lower-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I1ba563fd3144241127efe1cedf8853603dcca008

Constraints jsonschema to version lower than 4.0.0

This patch aim to unlock our validation before spending
more time to fix the following traceback:

```

[1954] /home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases$ /home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/tools/tox-log-command.sh check-schema
Logging check-schema output to /home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/.tox/validate/log/check-schema-results.log
   INFO: Checking data/series_status.yaml
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/.tox/validate/bin/check-schema", line 10, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/openstack_releases/cmds/check_schema.py", line 103, in main
    errors.extend(
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/openstack_releases/cmds/check_schema.py", line 66, in validate_one_file
    validator = make_validator_with_date(schema_data)
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/openstack_releases/cmds/check_schema.py", line 58, in make_validator_with_date
    return jsonschema.validators.extend(
```

commit_message:
Bump up Ansible supported versions

This change bumps up the maximum supported Ansible version to 4.x
(ansible-core 2.11.x) and minimum to 2.10. This synchronises Kayobe with
Kolla Ansible (see change I8b9212934dfab3831986e8db55671baee32f4bbd).

Uses of docker_image are updated. We must now provide the source
parameter. When source is build (for molecule), we replace force by
force_source and force_tag and move path and dockerfile under the build
parameter.

Use docker_image_info instead of docker_image_facts.

Handle update of ansible inside kolla-ansible virtualenv and document
how to do it for the kayobe virtualenv.

Change-Id: I7a4530f4f63ddb37aa30a617db5944b97bc3e17f

commit_message:
[CI] Cinder upgrade testing

To gain visibility into how our upgrades affect existing Cinder
volumes, a new testing path is required.
This patch adds it.

Additionally, it refactors the repeated actions and ensures that
we wait for volume deletions as well.

Change-Id: Ic08d461e6fdf91c378a87860765a489c2f86d690
Related-Bug: #1904062
(cherry picked from commit 62b8c6b68413330da032d14b45c6fbd340ec9e2d)

commit_message:
[CI] Test instance health after upgrade

Just like I added Cinder volume upgrade testing before, let's
also test similarly for Nova and Neutron. :-)

More robust debugging and refactor included.

Related-Bug: #1941706
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/806476
Change-Id: Id79df44254603f9b37ce7da2bfc796fc0b1ac91f
(cherry picked from commit daf534b4e0b7fd07a87cd9bde2731836ee40574c)

commit_message:
Add xena bundles

- add non-voting focal-xena bundle
- add non-voting impish-xena bundle
- remove groovy-victoria bundle
- charm-helpers sync for new charm-helpers changes
- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0

Change-Id: Ie59e35b3c4c9b80ac3579717f54db7017a0efff3

commit_message:
Rework requirements and drop pip-compile

This change reverts de60904bca0c8b10749bccb84bbfacc82407cb86 and
switches the deps for the various environments to only use upper
constraints for releasenotes and linters.  Molecule is not currently
compatible with molecule.

Change-Id: I925713c6a67ce281363a15a924729530dc3639fa
Related-Bug: #1942704
