commit_message:
Explicitly define engine runtime in containers.conf

We should not let the runtime container be decided by what rpms
are installed in the system. Let's specify this:
- runc on centos/rhel 8
- crun on centos/rhel 9

Closes-Bug: #1945521
Change-Id: I1eb52bc4d6a07be1e25f33aad1fbedae70050a3a

commit_message:
Enable Ceph RGW public port into firewall when using SSL

Adds CephRgwPublic endpoint port to firewall rule because it does
not match the CephRgwInternal endpoint port when using SSL

In train/ussuri/victoria we do not need the cephadm fix because it wasn't supported then.

Change-Id: Ia08b3d9b0fc96511e5a9202fa5e5a09487263e5b
(cherry picked from commit c69733bb652fa4bb546cd1dbf4cd40a4f157467d)
Closes-Bug: 1942198
(cherry picked from commit e3073243bd6c6bc61f3a805d6e3f028f6ea8ce6d)
(cherry picked from commit 530668d031eddfcd9fab39e4a4124cc35dcadc2f)
(cherry picked from commit da30175061840bf3d1768ad52fc33336a45c93ce)

commit_message:
test: Update e2e test according to service enabled

1. Add extenstions in config.yaml to support skip e2e case when service is disabled
2. Support compute, storage, network, other(identity, heat, configuration) config files to runthe corresponding cases

Change-Id: I310f4481d083319221045708cf5b311d51802b8c

commit_message:
Fix NVMe volume attach

Commit I5f73ec4287f6ab2a0a5ae83748947fa56a0eeb9d introduced new
feature and API changes. Until multiple volumes within one NVMe
subsystem will be utilized in Nova this patch fixes NVMe volumes
attach feature wich is broken at the moment

Closes-Bug: #1945323
Change-Id: I5760647a0b07bc785729aebaabeb0acbf0c01efe

[{'created': '2021-05-18 13:54:50.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Make setup module arguments configurable

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689
'}, {'created': '2021-06-02 16:18:28.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Make setup module arguments configurable

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689
'}, {'created': '2021-06-03 14:01:55.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Make setup module arguments configurable

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689
'}, {'created': '2021-06-08 14:39:34.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Make setup module arguments configurable

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689
'}, {'created': '2021-06-08 14:59:41.000000000', 'message': "Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: '*_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that the 'ansible' prefix is omitted, to ensure we collect the
module_setup fact which is used to manage the fact cache. The exact
improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as 18x on
systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/794610

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689
"}, {'created': '2021-06-08 15:02:04.000000000', 'message': "Make setup module arguments configurable

control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: '*_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that the 'ansible' prefix is omitted, to ensure we collect the
module_setup fact which is used to manage the fact cache. The exact
improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as 18x on
systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be

"}, {'created': '2021-06-09 13:07:47.000000000', 'message': "Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: '*_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that the 'ansible' prefix is omitted, to ensure we collect the
module_setup fact which is used to manage the fact cache. The exact
improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as 18x on
systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/794610
Story: 2007993
Task: 42586

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689
"}, {'created': '2021-06-18 16:59:28.000000000', 'message': "Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: 'ansible_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that including the 'ansible_' prefix causes meta facts module_setup
and gather_subset to be filtered, but this seems to be the only way to
get a good match on the interface facts. To work around this, we use
ansible_facts rather than module_setup to detect whether facts exist in
the cache.

The exact improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as
18x on systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/794610
Story: 2007993
Task: 42586

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689
"}, {'created': '2021-07-26 15:57:40.000000000', 'message': "Make setup module arguments configurable

control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are

(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: 'ansible_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that including the 'ansible_' prefix causes meta facts module_setup
and gather_subset to be filtered, but this seems to be the only way to
get a good match on the interface facts. To work around this, we use
ansible_facts rather than module_setup to detect whether facts exist in
the cache.

The exact improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as
18x on systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/794610
Story: 2007993
Task: 42586

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689

commit_message:
Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: 'ansible_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that including the 'ansible_' prefix causes meta facts module_setup
and gather_subset to be filtered, but this seems to be the only way to
get a good match on the interface facts. To work around this, we use
ansible_facts rather than module_setup to detect whether facts exist in
the cache.

The exact improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as
18x on systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/794610
Story: 2007993
Task: 42586

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689

commit_message:
[stable-only] Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2115133e7a85eee440c57bd5b1f48c7043d95004

commit_message:
Allow reboot to hard disk following iso ramdisk deploy.

Re-uses the force_persistent_boot_device driver_info option
which can be set to ``Never`` in order to set the virtual
media to one time boot.

Conflicts:
        ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/redfish/test_boot.py

Story: 2009042
Task: 42805

Change-Id: Ida7adb3c02db6279ef934797614eaa7be1f35daa
(cherry picked from commit 3bad548ce3d34207aa70fde8342082fe243bee31)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ibf954db27eff8799ccd1fe43454041d90a22c780

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-30 00:29:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix inactive session error in compute node creation

In the fix for bug 1839560 [1][2], soft-deleted compute nodes may be
restored, to ensure we can reuse ironic node UUIDs as compute node
UUIDs. While this seems to largely work, it results in some nasty errors
being generated [3]:

    InvalidRequestError This session is in 'inactive' state, due to the
    SQL transaction being rolled back; no further SQL can be emitted
    within this transaction.

This happens because compute_node_create is decorated with
pick_context_manager_writer, which begins a transaction. While
_compute_node_get_and_update_deleted claims that calling a second
pick_context_manager_writer decorated function will begin a new
subtransaction, this does not appear to be the case.

This change removes pick_context_manager_writer from the
compute_node_create function, and adds a new _compute_node_create
function which ensures the transaction is finished if
_compute_node_get_and_update_deleted is called.

The new unit test added here fails without this change.

This change marks the removal of the final FIXME from the functional
test added in [4].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1839560
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=89dd74ac7f1028daadf86cb18948e27fe9d1d411
[3] http://paste.openstack.org/show/786350/
[4] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695012/

Change-Id: Iae119ea8776bc7f2e5dbe2e502a743217beded73
Closes-Bug: #1853159
Related-Bug: #1853009
(cherry picked from commit 2383cbb4a518821d245fce316b3778c8ba8e5246)
(cherry picked from commit 5d2edde796d8639556aafebd6f0198d2bc791bd7)
"}, {'created': '2021-09-30 01:44:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix inactive session error in compute node creation

commit_message:
Fix inactive session error in compute node creation

In the fix for bug 1839560 [1][2], soft-deleted compute nodes may be
restored, to ensure we can reuse ironic node UUIDs as compute node
UUIDs. While this seems to largely work, it results in some nasty errors
being generated [3]:

    InvalidRequestError This session is in 'inactive' state, due to the
    SQL transaction being rolled back; no further SQL can be emitted
    within this transaction.

This happens because compute_node_create is decorated with
pick_context_manager_writer, which begins a transaction. While
_compute_node_get_and_update_deleted claims that calling a second
pick_context_manager_writer decorated function will begin a new
subtransaction, this does not appear to be the case.

This change removes pick_context_manager_writer from the
compute_node_create function, and adds a new _compute_node_create
function which ensures the transaction is finished if
_compute_node_get_and_update_deleted is called.

The new unit test added here fails without this change.

This change marks the removal of the final FIXME from the functional
test added in [4].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1839560
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=89dd74ac7f1028daadf86cb18948e27fe9d1d411
[3] http://paste.openstack.org/show/786350/
[4] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695012/

Change-Id: Iae119ea8776bc7f2e5dbe2e502a743217beded73
Closes-Bug: #1853159
Related-Bug: #1853009
(cherry picked from commit 2383cbb4a518821d245fce316b3778c8ba8e5246)
(cherry picked from commit 665c053315439e1345aa131f4839945d662fb3f3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-20 05:25:09.000000000', 'message': 'Seagate driver: fix get_volume_size()

The driver was reporting volume sizes in units of GB (10^9), the
default format the native array UIs, rather than GiB (2^30).  This
change also affects the HPE MSA, Dell PowerVault, and Lenovo drivers
as they use the same code.

Change-Id: I038f1399812e6c053622751eb62df89eff8a33db
'}, {'created': '2021-09-20 22:20:50.000000000', 'message': 'Seagate driver: fix get_volume_size()

The driver was reporting volume sizes in units of GB (10^9), the
default format the native array UIs, rather than GiB (2^30).  This
change also affects the HPE MSA, Dell PowerVault, and Lenovo drivers
as they use the same code.

Partial-Bug: #1922255

Change-Id: I038f1399812e6c053622751eb62df89eff8a33db

commit_message:
Seagate driver: fix get_volume_size()

The driver was reporting volume sizes in units of GB (10^9), the
default format the native array UIs, rather than GiB (2^30).  This
change also affects the HPE MSA, Dell PowerVault, and Lenovo drivers
as they use the same code.

Change-Id: I038f1399812e6c053622751eb62df89eff8a33db

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-22 05:34:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add Location to responses of Create VNF Package

According to SOL005 v3.3.1 Table 9.4.2.3.1-1, the HTTP response shall
include a "Location" HTTP header that contains the resource URI of the
individual VNF package resource.

In order to realize the above, this patch adds a Location header, which
includes a URL of a created VNF Packge, to responses for `POST
{apiRoot}/vnfpkgm/{apiMajorVersion}/vnf_packages` requests.

Also, this patch removes unused arguments from methods in ViewBuilder.

Signed-off-by: Hiromu Asahina <hiromu.asahina.az@hco.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: I754afaaf910de0048f4f11e259c644b3e0baea99

commit_message:
Add Location to responses of Create VNF Package

According to SOL005 v3.3.1 Table 9.4.2.3.1-1 [1], the HTTP response
shall include a "Location" HTTP header that contains the resource URI of
the individual VNF package resource.

In order to realize the above, this patch adds a Location header, which
includes a URL of a created VNF Package, to responses for `POST
{apiRoot}/vnfpkgm/{apiMajorVersion}/vnf_packages` requests.

Also, this patch removes unused arguments from methods in ViewBuilder.

[1] https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-SOL/001_099/005/03.03.01_60/gs_NFV-SOL005v030301p.pdf

Signed-off-by: Hiromu Asahina <hiromu.asahina.az@hco.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: I754afaaf910de0048f4f11e259c644b3e0baea99
Closes-Bug: #1915109

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-28 10:07:59.000000000', 'message': 's3api: fix the copy of non-ASCII objects

Trying to copy an object with non-ASCII characters in its name results
in, depending on the pipeline:
- an error code 412 because of a badly urlencoded path
- an error code 500 "TypeError: Expected a WSGI string"

This commit fixes the problem by calling str_to_wsgi on the object name
after it has been urldecoded. We do not need to call this on the
container name because it is supposed to contain only ASCII characters.

Change-Id: If837d4e55735b10a783c85d91f37fbea5e3baf1d
'}, {'created': '2021-09-28 11:25:33.000000000', 'message': 's3api: fix the copy of non-ASCII objects

- an error code 500 "TypeError: Expected a WSGI string"

This commit fixes the problem by calling str_to_wsgi on the object name
after it has been urldecoded. We do not need to call this on the
container name because it is supposed to contain only ASCII characters.

Change-Id: If837d4e55735b10a783c85d91f37fbea5e3baf1d
'}, {'created': '2021-09-30 02:05:23.000000000', 'message': 's3api: fix the copy of non-ASCII objects

Trying to copy an object with non-ASCII characters in its name results
in, depending on the pipeline:
- an error code 412 because of a badly urlencoded path
- an error code 500 "TypeError: Expected a WSGI string"

This commit fixes the problem by calling str_to_wsgi on the object name
after it has been urldecoded. We do not need to call this on the

Change-Id: If837d4e55735b10a783c85d91f37fbea5e3baf1d
'}]
commit_message:
s3api: fix the copy of non-ASCII objects

Trying to copy an object with non-ASCII characters in its name results
in, depending on the pipeline:
- an error code 412 because of a badly urlencoded path
- an error code 500 "TypeError: Expected a WSGI string"

This commit fixes the problem by calling str_to_wsgi on the object name
after it has been urldecoded. We do not need to call this on the
container name because it is supposed to contain only ASCII characters.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-30 00:35:34.000000000', 'message': 'Invalidate provider tree when compute node disappears

There is a race condition in nova-compute with the ironic virt driver
as nodes get rebalanced. It can lead to compute nodes being removed in
the DB and not repopulated. Ultimately this prevents these nodes from
being scheduled to.

The issue being addressed here is that if a compute node is deleted by a
host which thinks it is an orphan, then the resource provider for that
node might also be deleted. The compute host that owns the node might
not recreate the resource provider if it exists in the provider tree
cache.

This change fixes the issue by clearing resource providers from the
provider tree cache for which a compute node entry does not exist. Then,
when the available resource for the node is updated, the resource
providers are not found in the cache and get recreated in placement.

Change-Id: Ia53ff43e6964963cdf295604ba0fb7171389606e
Related-Bug: #1853009
Related-Bug: #1841481
(cherry picked from commit 2bb4527228c8e6fa4a1fa6cfbe80e8790e4e0789)
(cherry picked from commit 0fc104eeea065579f7fa9b52794d5151baefc84c)
(cherry picked from commit 456bcc784340a5674d25fbe6e707c36c583b504f)
'}]
commit_message:
Invalidate provider tree when compute node disappears

There is a race condition in nova-compute with the ironic virt driver
as nodes get rebalanced. It can lead to compute nodes being removed in
the DB and not repopulated. Ultimately this prevents these nodes from
being scheduled to.

The issue being addressed here is that if a compute node is deleted by a
host which thinks it is an orphan, then the resource provider for that
node might also be deleted. The compute host that owns the node might
not recreate the resource provider if it exists in the provider tree
cache.

This change fixes the issue by clearing resource providers from the
provider tree cache for which a compute node entry does not exist. Then,
when the available resource for the node is updated, the resource
providers are not found in the cache and get recreated in placement.

Change-Id: Ia53ff43e6964963cdf295604ba0fb7171389606e
Related-Bug: #1853009
Related-Bug: #1841481
(cherry picked from commit 2bb4527228c8e6fa4a1fa6cfbe80e8790e4e0789)
(cherry picked from commit 0fc104eeea065579f7fa9b52794d5151baefc84c)
(cherry picked from commit 456bcc784340a5674d25fbe6e707c36c583b504f)

subject: Add functional regression test for bug 1853009
messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-09-30 00:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-09-30 04:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded. For checking Nova with Ceph, add a comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Ceph Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/811815/1/iscsi : SUCCESS in 2h 34m 50s'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-30 00:35:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional regression test for bug 1853009

Bug 1853009 describes a race condition involving multiple nova-compute
services with ironic. As the compute services start up, the hash ring
rebalances, and the compute services have an inconsistent view of which
is responsible for a compute node.

The sequence of actions here is adapted from a real world log [1], where
multiple nova-compute services were started simultaneously. In some
cases mocks are used to simulate race conditions.

There are three main issues with the behaviour:

* host2 deletes the orphan node compute node after host1 has taken
  ownership of it.

* host1 assumes that another compute service will not delete its nodes.
  Once a node is in rt.compute_nodes, it is not removed again unless the
  node is orphaned. This prevents host1 from recreating the compute
  node.

* host1 assumes that another compute service will not delete its
  resource providers. Once an RP is in the provider tree, it is not
  removed.

This functional test documents the current behaviour, with the idea that
it can be updated as this behaviour is fixed.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/786272/

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ice4071722de54e8d20bb8c3795be22f1995940cd
Related-Bug: #1853009
Related-Bug: #1853159

commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1853009

Bug 1853009 describes a race condition involving multiple nova-compute
services with ironic. As the compute services start up, the hash ring
rebalances, and the compute services have an inconsistent view of which
is responsible for a compute node.

The sequence of actions here is adapted from a real world log [1], where
multiple nova-compute services were started simultaneously. In some
cases mocks are used to simulate race conditions.

There are three main issues with the behaviour:

* host2 deletes the orphan node compute node after host1 has taken
  ownership of it.

* host1 assumes that another compute service will not delete its nodes.
  Once a node is in rt.compute_nodes, it is not removed again unless the
  node is orphaned. This prevents host1 from recreating the compute
  node.

* host1 assumes that another compute service will not delete its
  resource providers. Once an RP is in the provider tree, it is not
  removed.

This functional test documents the current behaviour, with the idea that
it can be updated as this behaviour is fixed.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/786272/

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ice4071722de54e8d20bb8c3795be22f1995940cd
Related-Bug: #1853009
Related-Bug: #1853159
(cherry picked from commit 59d9871e8a0672538f8ffc43ae99b3d1c4b08909)
(cherry picked from commit c260e75d012cc4fae596d5de185afad6fb24068c)
(cherry picked from commit 34d5bca6bc612f41ac3fc33447cd2ba83bf446ba)

commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: Ie1fa7f6b2cf3cf2fc4bc0b6b37e997b7601b0079

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib67d08cbde3f952ae40a549d8458bf1d2dd99c7f

services with ironic. As the compute services start up, the hash ring
rebalances, and the compute services have an inconsistent view of which
is responsible for a compute node.

The sequence of actions here is adapted from a real world log [1], where
multiple nova-compute services were started simultaneously. In some
cases mocks are used to simulate race conditions.

There are three main issues with the behaviour:

* host2 deletes the orphan node compute node after host1 has taken
  ownership of it.

* host1 assumes that another compute service will not delete its nodes.
  Once a node is in rt.compute_nodes, it is not removed again unless the
  node is orphaned. This prevents host1 from recreating the compute
  node.

* host1 assumes that another compute service will not delete its
  resource providers. Once an RP is in the provider tree, it is not

This functional test documents the current behaviour, with the idea that

messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-09-30 00:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-09-30 03:02:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded. For checking Nova with Ceph, add a comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Ceph Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/811812/1/iscsi : SUCCESS in 2h 29m 26s'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-30 00:29:44.000000000', 'message': 'Invalidate provider tree when compute node disappears

There is a race condition in nova-compute with the ironic virt driver
as nodes get rebalanced. It can lead to compute nodes being removed in
the DB and not repopulated. Ultimately this prevents these nodes from
being scheduled to.

The issue being addressed here is that if a compute node is deleted by a
host which thinks it is an orphan, then the resource provider for that
node might also be deleted. The compute host that owns the node might
not recreate the resource provider if it exists in the provider tree
cache.

This change fixes the issue by clearing resource providers from the
provider tree cache for which a compute node entry does not exist. Then,
when the available resource for the node is updated, the resource
providers are not found in the cache and get recreated in placement.

Change-Id: Ia53ff43e6964963cdf295604ba0fb7171389606e
Related-Bug: #1853009
Related-Bug: #1841481
(cherry picked from commit 2bb4527228c8e6fa4a1fa6cfbe80e8790e4e0789)
(cherry picked from commit 0fc104eeea065579f7fa9b52794d5151baefc84c)
'}]
commit_message:
Invalidate provider tree when compute node disappears

There is a race condition in nova-compute with the ironic virt driver
as nodes get rebalanced. It can lead to compute nodes being removed in
the DB and not repopulated. Ultimately this prevents these nodes from
being scheduled to.

The issue being addressed here is that if a compute node is deleted by a
host which thinks it is an orphan, then the resource provider for that
node might also be deleted. The compute host that owns the node might
not recreate the resource provider if it exists in the provider tree
cache.

This change fixes the issue by clearing resource providers from the
provider tree cache for which a compute node entry does not exist. Then,
when the available resource for the node is updated, the resource
providers are not found in the cache and get recreated in placement.

Change-Id: Ia53ff43e6964963cdf295604ba0fb7171389606e
Related-Bug: #1853009
Related-Bug: #1841481
(cherry picked from commit 2bb4527228c8e6fa4a1fa6cfbe80e8790e4e0789)
(cherry picked from commit 0fc104eeea065579f7fa9b52794d5151baefc84c)

commit_message:
Add small /srv volume for optional swift data

Most tripleo node roles store their state in /var with the exception
of the ObjectStorage role which stores its state in /srv.

This change adds a very small /srv volume which will generally remain
empty.  A documentation change will be proposed which shows how to set
custom growvols values to grow /srv in the rare case that the
ObjectStorage role is used.

Change-Id: Ide8776ffdb62bff46c3df4773fc7b01e9710373f
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
(cherry picked from commit 998936c734a8d292660323dab4571069335782a4)

subject: Shrink whole disk image from 40G to 6G
messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-09-29 03:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-29 19:37:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-29 03:39:24.000000000', 'message': 'Shrink whole disk image from 40G to 6G

Now that images are converted to raw on the undercloud we need to
consider the implications of creating a 40G whole-disk image which is
mostly empty.

The raw image file on the undercloud is sparse, so storage space is
not consumed. However transferring from the undercloud to deploying
nodes will transfer all 40G of mostly zeros, and ironic-python-agent
will also write all those zeros to disk during deployment. This makes
deployment unnecessarily slow and will cause network scalabilty issues
for large overcloud deployments.

This change reduces the size of the physical root partition to 6GB,
and makes the logical volumes big enough for space to not run out
during image building. The growvols utility will be used post-deploy
to grow all of the volumes (not just /var).

The growvols playbook now has the following default to ensure all
partitions are grown to an appropriate size:
/=8GB /tmp=1GB /var/log=10GB /var/log/audit=2GB /home=1GB /var=100%

Change-Id: I34b57958ba84714c54ed8148600e7fd0860e3ba8
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
(cherry picked from commit 0203c0aa6300015ac12bd2e95fa86b382a6a22cb)
'}]
commit_message:
Shrink whole disk image from 40G to 6G

Now that images are converted to raw on the undercloud we need to
consider the implications of creating a 40G whole-disk image which is
mostly empty.

The raw image file on the undercloud is sparse, so storage space is
not consumed. However transferring from the undercloud to deploying
nodes will transfer all 40G of mostly zeros, and ironic-python-agent
will also write all those zeros to disk during deployment. This makes
deployment unnecessarily slow and will cause network scalabilty issues
for large overcloud deployments.

This change reduces the size of the physical root partition to 6GB,
and makes the logical volumes big enough for space to not run out
during image building. The growvols utility will be used post-deploy
to grow all of the volumes (not just /var).

The growvols playbook now has the following default to ensure all
partitions are grown to an appropriate size:
/=8GB /tmp=1GB /var/log=10GB /var/log/audit=2GB /home=1GB /var=100%

Change-Id: I34b57958ba84714c54ed8148600e7fd0860e3ba8
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
(cherry picked from commit 0203c0aa6300015ac12bd2e95fa86b382a6a22cb)

subject: Unmask and enable tmp.mount for overcloud-partition
messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-09-29 03:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-29 19:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-29 03:39:24.000000000', 'message': 'Unmask and enable tmp.mount for overcloud-partition

In recent centos 8 images tmp.mount is masked, which causes issues
with all defined LVM mounts (/ is readonly, other mounts fail).

This change unmasks and enables tmp.mounted so the existing LVM /tmp
mounts correctly. It also makes fsck-passno compliant with the
documentation[1] so that / has value 1 and all other mounts are set to
2.

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
[1] https://www.man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/fstab.5.html

Change-Id: Ib517e73845a7698f873a4f3207ffa9c54cdbcbef
(cherry picked from commit 1635ba8abe518cd765bbeef4eb6724169d92e208)
'}]
commit_message:
Unmask and enable tmp.mount for overcloud-partition

In recent centos 8 images tmp.mount is masked, which causes issues
with all defined LVM mounts (/ is readonly, other mounts fail).

This change unmasks and enables tmp.mounted so the existing LVM /tmp
mounts correctly. It also makes fsck-passno compliant with the
documentation[1] so that / has value 1 and all other mounts are set to
2.

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
[1] https://www.man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/fstab.5.html

Change-Id: Ib517e73845a7698f873a4f3207ffa9c54cdbcbef
(cherry picked from commit 1635ba8abe518cd765bbeef4eb6724169d92e208)

subject: Don't depend on block-device elements
messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-09-29 03:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-29 19:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-29 03:39:24.000000000', 'message': "Don't depend on block-device elements

Element search order is not deterministic, so when
overcloud-partition-uefi depends on block-device-efi, it is not
possible to know which block-device-default.yaml will be applied.

To avoid this, don't depend on the block-device-* elements ever, and
just duplicate what they do within these elements.

Change-Id: Icea31169a68ab0ea24e6cd1ba0f7d8e88cc07f1f
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
(cherry picked from commit fe5cc75a2e9e4804851778130ce4b4b539af1176)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't depend on block-device elements

Element search order is not deterministic, so when
overcloud-partition-uefi depends on block-device-efi, it is not
possible to know which block-device-default.yaml will be applied.

To avoid this, don't depend on the block-device-* elements ever, and
just duplicate what they do within these elements.

Change-Id: Icea31169a68ab0ea24e6cd1ba0f7d8e88cc07f1f
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
(cherry picked from commit fe5cc75a2e9e4804851778130ce4b4b539af1176)

commit_message:
Add test to expose app cred secret hash truncating CVE

This commit updates the application credential authentication tests to
show that the auth flow for application credentials exposes a false
sense of security. Specifically, long secrets generate long hashes that
can be truncated when they are inserted into keystone database.

This allows end users to create long secrets but they don't need the
entire secret to authenticate for a token.

Partial-Bug: 1901891
Change-Id: I1a1969a83898f77f5257cee5c81ecf1972dea1b3

commit_message:
Deprecate network data v1 definition

Change the constant OVERCLOUD_NETWORKS_FILE to point
to network_data_default.yaml in THT. (The new v2 default).

Add check, and prompt the user for confirmation in case
legacy networks definition is provided. The check and prompt
can be disabled with the '--allow-deprecated-network-data'
argument.

Also add the '--yes' in 'OvercloudDeploy' and remove it in the
Update nad Upgrade classes that will now inherit it.

blueprint network-data-v2
Depends-On: I618c0a0d99c934fb65a6af30bc76096d52d4679d
Depends-On: I759402fb22a9a3fd0fc06c8e107eee6eb5798c51
Change-Id: I2d14d9e587fce28ea0897bb235c9dedc8f68fa12
(cherry picked from commit 13a9ced063ded3da3ed5f10acd4ce4373f734601)

commit_message:
Enable support for Libvirt modular daemons

This change enables support for modular libvirt
daemon configurations.

Also deprecating modular_libvirt param so that modular-libvirt
is default configuration and once we remove non-modular libvirt
configuration in next release, this param can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-nova/+/785305
Co-Authored-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id9c1bfcc88f60f61877fe34b1ee01677d3bcc1b0

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-27 09:58:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add a new bind-mount for vTPM logs

swtpm has its own log directory, and it's hardcoded in libvirt[1].
For the records, this location is currently set to:
/var/log/swtpm/libvirt/qemu

In order to keep some kind of consistency with the current log structure
in /var/log/containers/libvirt, we will keep the "qemu" subdirectory -
it already exists for other qemu-related services, therefore it makes
sense to keep that subdirectory.

This is possible since the swtpm log filename is compose of the instance
ID suffixed by "-swtpm.log", leading to a clear view.

[1] https://gitlab.com/libvirt/libvirt/-/commit/f9cd29a2e44d61da0fc94f245d27206ea66e1161

Related: rhbz#2007314
Related-Bug: #1902468
Change-Id: Ibc80621a622a4eb4ef31520439ded8a08ce50c96

commit_message:
Add a new bind-mount for vTPM logs

swtpm has its own log directory, and it's hardcoded in libvirt[1].
For the records, this location is currently set to:
/var/log/swtpm/libvirt/qemu

In order to keep some kind of consistency with the current log structure
in /var/log/containers/libvirt, we will keep the "qemu" subdirectory -
it already exists for other qemu-related services, therefore it makes
sense to keep that subdirectory.

This is possible since the swtpm log filename is composed of the
instance ID suffixed by "-swtpm.log", leading to a clear view.

[1] https://gitlab.com/libvirt/libvirt/-/commit/f9cd29a2e44d61da0fc94f245d27206ea66e1161

Related: rhbz#2007314
Related-Bug: #1902468
Change-Id: Ibc80621a622a4eb4ef31520439ded8a08ce50c96

[{'created': '2021-09-30 00:46:00.000000000', 'message': 'Stop configuring install_command in tox.

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: Ifff342863fc90d5b5ca77aee129cb33a2cf79589
Co-Authored-By: tushargite96 <tushargite96@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: Ifff342863fc90d5b5ca77aee129cb33a2cf79589
Co-Authored-By: tushargite96 <tushargite96@gmail.com>

subject: Plumb allow_modify_pipeline through run_wsgi/run_server
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-08-13 19:34:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-08-13 20:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2021-08-16 19:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

why is this better than the config option?

instead of `swift-proxy-server --no-allow-pipeline-modification` what if we just had a `swift-insecure-proxy`?'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-08-16 21:47:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> why is this better than the config option?

It avoids the need to add & document a config option, which would likely make ops wonder about it. It also avoids the debate between always-call-a-thing-that-maybe-takes-an-action vs maybe-call-a-thing-(if-it-exists)-that-always-tries-to-take-an-action.

> instead of `swift-proxy-server --no-allow-pipeline-modification` what if we just had a `swift-insecure-proxy`?

Don't we already have enough bin script entry points??

I'm'a try one more idea I just had, let's see what you think of *that* one..."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-08-16 22:16:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2021-08-17 20:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(4 comments)

I like this better than previous attempts

I miss the pipeline logging when allow_modify_pipeline is False

I imagined a diff that might be smaller by "re-using" global_conf; but you can't really get it "into" run_server and it probably wouldn't really look any better anyway.

commit_message:
Plumb allow_modify_pipeline through run_wsgi/run_server

Otherwise, there's no good way to launch a multi-worker, gatekeeper-less
proxy server.

Change-Id: I343609e5c0baeddf91facde463f4458c82fd3193

(2 comments)

This needs a unit test and a release note.'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-05-30 06:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Colleen,
Thanks for your comments! Before I add unit test and release notes, I’d like to make more clear about my implementation. The ‘enabled’ value has been handled by  functionality ldap_res_to_model https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/identity/backends/ldap/core.py#L260 like Kristi comments mentioned, so after _ldap_res_to_model, if it is still an integer, then I guess the integer value can be treated as bool true. And also with sqlalchemy 1.1.x, it take integer as bool True without my patch.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-05-30 20:29:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Hi Colleen,
 > Thanks for your comments! Before I add unit test and release notes,
 > I’d like to make more clear about my implementation. The ‘enabled’
 > value has been handled by  functionality ldap_res_to_model
 > https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/identity/backends/ldap/core.py#L260
 > like Kristi comments mentioned, so after _ldap_res_to_model, if it
 > is still an integer, then I guess the integer value can be treated
 > as bool true. And also with sqlalchemy 1.1.x, it take integer as
 > bool True without my patch.

If it is an integer, then its value could be either 1 (enabled) or 0 (disabled). If I understand your code correctly, it treats all integer values as 'enabled' by setting 'enabled' to True, and ignoring the cases when 'enabled'  could be 0."}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-05-31 01:34:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Colleen,
You are right about my code. But 'enabled' value is not 0 or 1, in my case it is 544. I found https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/305144/how-to-use-useraccountcontrol-to-manipulate-user-account-properties, it's just for AD, I guess there are more values for different LDAP server. So I think user need to configure right value for their enabled_mask, enabled_invert and enabled_emulation in keystone configuration file to handle their  backend LDAP return value.  For common case, after functionality ldap_res_to_model, if it's still an integer, then we take it as bool True."}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-10 05:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-12 02:02:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-06-12 17:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-13 01:22:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I have not used the  user_enabled_mask option, so after ldap driver, it still an integer.'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-13 01:25:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2019-06-19 16:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

The release note is still missing.'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-21 02:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-21 02:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-21 05:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-21 07:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-24 01:32:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-24 03:50:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-24 05:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-06-25 15:22:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

> I have not used the  user_enabled_mask option, so after ldap
 > driver, it still an integer.


Have you tried using it? It is there to solve this problem. It defaults to 0, which is no mask, which means the integer from ldap is passed directly. If you set it to an integer, typically 2, it should convert the attribute to a boolean.'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-26 01:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)

Yes, if set user_enabled_mask, the issue here can be resolved. But since our OpenStack distribution has been deployed in real production environment without this attribute, when upgrade, it is still need to work without this attribute.'}, {'account_id': 16264, 'date': '2019-06-26 02:02:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-06-26 17:54:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

> Yes, if set user_enabled_mask, the issue here can be resolved. But
 > since our OpenStack distribution has been deployed in real
 > production environment without this attribute, when upgrade, it is
 > still need to work without this attribute.

I don't think it is reasonable to patch keystone in order to correct a mistake in your deployment's configuration. The configuration option is there for this purpose, so I would suggest you update your deployment to use it."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2019-07-08 19:54:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

I agree with Colleen. I don't see the benefit of patching keystone to work around a deployment error. I am open to accepting a fix if it is shown to be a wide spread problem, but this is one of the first times I've seen this issue in practice."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2020-01-28 17:17:02.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Morgan Fainberg with the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Morgan Fainberg <morgan.fainberg@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2021-09-30 00:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

PLease close'}]

commit_message:
Fix create nonlocal user issue

In sqlalchemy 1.2.x version, Boolean datatype enforces strict
True/False/None values. When create nonlocal user, it set
enabled an integer before the fix, then creation failed. In this fix,
change enabled to real bool value to work with sqlalchemy 1.2.x version.

Change-Id: I076e2c34d24469ff68abfd107b45f5fc63306409
Closes-Bug: #1830307

commit_message:
sharding: Raise fewer errors when the on-disk files change out from under us

We've occasionally seen probe tests drop logs like

Jun  2 18:29:02 saio container-6021: ERROR __call__ error with GET ...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/container/server.py", line 853, in __call__
    res = getattr(self, req.method)(req)
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/common/utils.py", line 1999, in _timing_stats
    resp = func(ctrl, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/container/server.py", line 702, in GET
    info, is_deleted = broker.get_info_is_deleted()
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/container/backend.py", line 820, in get_info_is_deleted
    info = self.get_info()
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/container/backend.py", line 900, in get_info
    state, stats = self._get_alternate_object_stats()
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/container/backend.py", line 878, in _get_alternate_object_stats
    other_info = self.get_brokers()[0]._get_info()
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/container/backend.py", line 866, in _get_info
    with self.get() as conn:
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/contextlib.py", line 81, in __enter__
    return next(self.gen)
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/common/db.py", line 471, in get
    raise DatabaseConnectionError(self.db_file, "DB doesn't exist")
swift.common.db.DatabaseConnectionError: DB connection error ...

The tests still pass, but it'd still be better if the container-server
didn't 500.

Change-Id: I5e9428751b09bf7aafe2a552c59187e3d8e5e1e6

> > [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/src/branch/master/config/release/tripleo-ci/CentOS-7/train.yml#L88
> 
> Done

Thank you Chandan!'}]

commit_message:
Pull tripleo-operator-ansible from current tripleo component

Currently if a change lands in tripleo-operator-ansible, we need
to wait for tripleo component promotion to get it into upstream
CI.

As our deployment is drived by tripleo-operator-ansible, it increases
the waiting time to get the fixes and delays in reviews.

In order to fix that, we need to add tripleo-operator-ansible under
required packages so that we can pull it from tripleo current repo
and test it on time.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8514cdd9578176d867e2e1f4c104a8cb0f6811f6

commit_message:
Nova: Include new puppet classes for castellan options

The keymgr_* parameters are deprecated and these parameters will be
completely migrated to nova::key_manager. This change ensures the new
classes are included.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/772142
Change-Id: Idcb75f91b4abbb7fa66bf199026611304a4f4467

commit_message:
Add rabbitmq secret volume + mount for audit usage cronjob

This PS adds the rabbitmq secret volume + mount for the audit
usage cronjob, as it was previously missing and the job's command(s)
were failing when run.

In addition, add labels to the CronJob's metadata, so that it can
be picked up for pre-delete hooks.

Change-Id: I0a2ed0655702b4e41cc12d3908b9aed141e6f0d2

commit_message:
Use stack name during upgrade converge

Change[1] removed all arguments for update converge. Without
stack name it would use the default 'overcloud'.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/+/806565

Related-Bug: #1945091
Change-Id: I5a9e451419fd679baa8557bd3661b6a7ba83a643

The functionality of use_swift where a local apache2 instance was set up
for metadata was deprecated for removal and this change actually removes
this. However, the option itself can still be used as an indicator
whether Swift is intended to be used for simplestreams metadata or not.
If the usage is explicitly requested, the charm but Swift endpoints are
not yet present, the charm will now will set the unit state to
maintenance in addition to local logging that was done previously.

Swift presence checking is now endpoint-based instead of being
service-based (no use for the case where endpoints are not set up while
the service is in the catalog).

The lack of swift presence is also ignored for the purposes of
generating proxy setting context - if the endpoint is not there there is
not point in trying to generate NO_PROXY rules for it.

This change also makes test bundles use ceph as a storage medium for
glance since out of space errors were encountered during testing as the
glance unit was running out of space for image storage.

Closes-Bug: #1942047

Change-Id: I6519b1449806ad19ee4545501bc4631c9f8e535f

commit_message:
Remove local apache2 install, rework use_swift

The functionality of use_swift where a local apache2 instance was set up
for metadata was deprecated for removal and this change actually removes
this. However, the option itself can still be used as an indicator
whether Swift is intended to be used for simplestreams metadata or not.
If the usage is explicitly requested, the charm but Swift endpoints are
not yet present, the charm will now will set the unit state to
maintenance in addition to local logging that was done previously.

Swift presence checking is now endpoint-based instead of being
service-based (no use for the case where endpoints are not set up while
the service is in the catalog).

The lack of swift presence is also ignored for the purposes of
generating proxy setting context - if the endpoint is not there there is
not point in trying to generate NO_PROXY rules for it.

This change also makes test bundles use ceph as a storage medium for
glance since out of space errors were encountered during testing as the
glance unit was running out of space for image storage.

Closes-Bug: #1942047
Closes-Bug: #1934563
Closes-Bug: #1938069

commit_message:
Add xena bundles

- add non-voting focal-xena bundle
- add non-voting impish-xena bundle
- remove groovy-victoria bundle
- rebuild to pick up charm-helpers changes
- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0

Change-Id: I15112d21e7d79336cdaee84e0792cb0586dc9013

[{'created': '2021-03-09 20:30:20.000000000', 'message': 'Expose volume_attachments in Volume OVO

In change-id Iabf9c3fab56ffef50695ce45745f193273822b39 we left the
`volume_attachment` out of the expected attributes of the Volume OVO
(even when te DB layer is providing that information) because it was
breaking some unit tests.

This means that in some cases we are unnecessarily loading the
attachments again (manually or via lazy loading) once we have the volume
OVO because that field is not set.

In this patch we populate the `volume_attachment` when we load the
Volume OVO from the DB.

Change-Id: I6576832b2c2722ab749cfe70bbc2058ead816c36

commit_message:
Expose volume_attachments in Volume OVO

In change-id Iabf9c3fab56ffef50695ce45745f193273822b39 we left the
`volume_attachment` out of the expected attributes of the Volume OVO
(even when te DB layer is providing that information) because it was
breaking some unit tests.

This means that in some cases we are unnecessarily loading the
attachments again (manually or via lazy loading) once we have the volume
OVO because that field is not set.

In this patch we populate the `volume_attachment` when we load the
Volume OVO from the DB.

Change-Id: I6576832b2c2722ab749cfe70bbc2058ead816c36

commit_message:
Neutron: Explicitly set the default hepervisor name

... to ensure that the consistent hypervisor name is used in both nova
and neutron.

Change-Id: Ibe2f670872252b177643cb1a06c69010bcba7bb4
Related-Bug: #1926693
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/763563
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/796326

Only if they want to use collections. The old format is still accepted.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-09-27 09:10:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-09-27 09:11:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-09-27 13:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-09-29 10:18:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

There is a limitation of this approach - it is not possible to use plugins from collections in kayobe-config unless you're executing a custom playbook. For example, we might want to use a lookup or filter plugin from a collection in one of the extra vars files.

I think that could be addressed as a follow up."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-09-29 10:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Another limitation is that it is not possible to use plugins from collections in Kolla Ansible.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-09-29 16:23:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Support Ansible collections

This change adds support for installing Ansible collections via
requirements.yml in Kayobe or Kayobe config.

Story: 2008391
Task: 41315

Change-Id: I764ff019a18266b593add7ab80ee095d7d07a869

commit_message:
Use an ImageCache for provided boot/deploy ISO images

When pre-built images are used, they can be quite large (CoreOS is more
than 700 MiB, the same probably applies to other live ISOs). When
deploying many nodes at the same time, the disk usage may become really
large.

This change uses the same ImageCache as for instance images for ISO
images as well.

Story: #2008909
Task: #42497
Change-Id: I891fd484f98042039895d82046199e8b29975100

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-28 19:33:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix job definition as devstack-plugin-ceph is branched

As devstack-plugin-ceph is branched, we moved stable branch
jobs definition in their respective branch

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786308
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786309
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786310
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786311

But we did not cleanup the master version of job definition so that we
do not need to do it for future stable branches. When stable/xena is cut
from master the ./.zuul.yaml version of jobs in stable/xena has the stable
branches variant which is being picked up by zuul for stable branch gate
instead of their own version defined in their stable branch.

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/bc088154e50440fe9a2cacf52426748a/log/zuul-info/inventory.yaml#241

And it started failing ceph job when ceph version was update for master and
same is being picked by stable branch testin so due to above branch matching
logic.

To avoid this in future when we will have stable/yoga or so we need to cleanup
this in master. Master repo will only keep the master version of jobs and no
stable branch jobs.

As we do not have stable branch cut for stable/rocky and older, I am keeping their
jobs in master but as separate file.

Closes-Bug: #1945358
Change-Id: I7061f8d1491ff957452c9c777e40186a4e9c324e
'}, {'created': '2021-09-29 03:42:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix job definition as devstack-plugin-ceph is branched

As devstack-plugin-ceph is branched, we moved stable branch
jobs definition in their respective branch

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786308
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786309
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786310
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786311

But we did not cleanup the master version of job definition so that we
do not need to do it for future stable branches. When stable/xena is cut
from master the ./.zuul.yaml version of jobs in stable/xena has the stable
branches variant which is being picked up by zuul for stable branch gate
instead of their own version defined in their stable branch.

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/bc088154e50440fe9a2cacf52426748a/log/zuul-info/inventory.yaml#241

And it started failing ceph job when ceph version was update for master and
same is being picked by stable branch testin so due to above branch matching
logic.

To avoid this in future when we will have stable/yoga or so we need to cleanup
this in master. Master repo will only keep the master version of jobs and no
stable branch jobs.

Other stable/rocky and older jobs will be moved to stable/stein so that we have
them there if anyone cut the branch.

This also remove the master-only(supposed to run on master gate only)
job 'devstack-plugin-ceph-master-tempest'.

Closes-Bug: #1945358
Change-Id: I7061f8d1491ff957452c9c777e40186a4e9c324e
(cherry picked from commit bf07abf7a9af586b280914fe0f8c00b130ac1b65)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix job definition as devstack-plugin-ceph is branched

As devstack-plugin-ceph is branched, we moved stable branch
jobs definition in their respective branch

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786308
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786309
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786310
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786311

But we did not cleanup the master version of job definition so that we
do not need to do it for future stable branches. When stable/xena is cut
from master the ./.zuul.yaml version of jobs in stable/xena has the stable
branches variant which is being picked up by zuul for stable branch gate
instead of their own version defined in their stable branch.

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/bc088154e50440fe9a2cacf52426748a/log/zuul-info/inventory.yaml#241

And it started failing ceph job when ceph version was update for master and
same is being picked by stable branch testin so due to above branch matching
logic.

To avoid this in future when we will have stable/yoga or so we need to cleanup
this in master. Master repo will only keep the master version of jobs and no
stable branch jobs.

Other stable/rocky and older jobs will be moved to stable/stein so that we have
them there if anyone cut the branch.

This also remove the master-only(supposed to run on master gate only)
job 'devstack-plugin-ceph-master-tempest'.

Closes-Bug: #1945358
Change-Id: I7061f8d1491ff957452c9c777e40186a4e9c324e
(cherry picked from commit bf07abf7a9af586b280914fe0f8c00b130ac1b65)

An earlier patch[1] added a mapping for context 'system_scope'
to 'system' when enforce was called with a RequestContext

that may contain the context 'system_scope' element. When this

commit_message:
Map system_scope in creds dictionary

An earlier patch[1] added a mapping for context 'system_scope'
to 'system' when enforce was called with a RequestContext
object. However, enforce can also be called with a creds dictionary
that may contain the context 'system_scope' element. When this
occured, 'system_scope' was not mapped to 'system' and the enforce
would fail with an InvalidScope exception.
This patch moves the 'system_scope' mapping from only occuring
with RequestContext objects to also map it when a creds dictonary
is passed to enforce.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.policy/+/578995

Change-Id: I83a22c3f825bad0c88018118f8630a20a445965e

commit_message:
Replace "tenant_id" with "project_id" in Quota engine

This is part of the remaining technical debt of the specs
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/newton/moving-to-keystone-v3.html

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/keystone-v3

Change-Id: I1faf520d3cdafe2de873525c8ebe1fa2114bdcd7

what we want here.

commit_message:
doc: admin: generic_driver: fix indentation

The extra spaces makes sphinx think the line should be bolded. But this is not
what we want here.

Signed-off-by: Arturo Borrero Gonzalez <arturo@debian.org>
Change-Id: Ie466a5a1a5db7ddb3e3da121fab6d9dbcb8fcc7e

Fix up README

There was a section out of place at the very bottom.

I took the opportunity to include various improvements
throughout.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-28 19:27:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix job definition as devstack-plugin-ceph is branched

As devstack-plugin-ceph is branched, we moved stable branch
jobs definition in their respective branch

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786308
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786309
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786310
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786311

But we did not cleanup the master version of job definition so that we
do not need to do it for future stable branches. When stable/xena is cut
from master the ./.zuul.yaml version of jobs in stable/xena has the stable
branches variant which is being picked up by zuul for stable branch gate
instead of their own version defined in their stable branch.

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/bc088154e50440fe9a2cacf52426748a/log/zuul-info/inventory.yaml#241

And it started failing ceph job when ceph version was update for master and
same is being picked by stable branch testin so due to above branch matching
logic.

To avoid this in future when we will have stable/yoga or so we need to cleanup
this in master. Master repo will only keep the master version of jobs and no
stable branch jobs.

As we do not have stable branch cut for stable/rocky and older, I am keeping their
jobs in master but as separate file.

Closes-Bug: #1945358
Change-Id: I7061f8d1491ff957452c9c777e40186a4e9c324e

commit_message:
Fix job definition as devstack-plugin-ceph is branched

As devstack-plugin-ceph is branched, we moved stable branch
jobs definition in their respective branch

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786308
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786309
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786310
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/786311

But we did not cleanup the master version of job definition so that we
do not need to do it for future stable branches. When stable/xena is cut
from master the ./.zuul.yaml version of jobs in stable/xena has the stable
branches variant which is being picked up by zuul for stable branch gate
instead of their own version defined in their stable branch.

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/bc088154e50440fe9a2cacf52426748a/log/zuul-info/inventory.yaml#241

And it started failing ceph job when ceph version was update for master and
same is being picked by stable branch testin so due to above branch matching
logic.

To avoid this in future when we will have stable/yoga or so we need to cleanup
this in master. Master repo will only keep the master version of jobs and no
stable branch jobs.

Other stable/rocky and older jobs will be moved to stable/stein so that we have
them there if anyone cut the branch.

Closes-Bug: #1945358
Change-Id: I7061f8d1491ff957452c9c777e40186a4e9c324e

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-28 15:33:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix misleading FixedIpsSubnetsNotOnSameSegment error

When creating an slaac ipv6 subnet in a multisegment environment where
other ipv4 subnets already existed, an error was raised but the subnet
was created anyway. Now ipv4 subnets are separated from ipv6 when
filtering subnets on fixed_ip segment.

Closes-Bug: #1944948
Change-Id: I908265039217c5e251f746abc5800808f8f21e68
Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-09-28 15:35:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix misleading FixedIpsSubnetsNotOnSameSegment error

When creating an slaac ipv6 subnet in a multisegment environment where
other ipv4 subnets already existed, an error was raised but the subnet
was created anyway. Now ipv4 subnets are separated from ipv6 when
filtering subnets on fixed_ip segment.

Closes-Bug: #1944948
Change-Id: I908265039217c5e251f746abc5800808f8f21e68
Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix misleading FixedIpsSubnetsNotOnSameSegment error

When creating an slaac ipv6 subnet in a multisegment environment where
other ipv4 subnets already existed, an error was raised but the subnet
was created anyway. Now ipv4 subnets are separated from ipv6 when
filtering subnets on fixed_ip segment.

Closes-Bug: #1944948
Change-Id: I908265039217c5e251f746abc5800808f8f21e68
Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-29 09:12:46.000000000', 'message': 'Stop configuring install_command in tox.

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: I2e440cfe22097256cff2dc019458e58c2616df27
Co-Authored-By: tushargite96 <tushargite96@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: I2e440cfe22097256cff2dc019458e58c2616df27
Co-Authored-By: tushargite96 <tushargite96@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-20 16:36:40.000000000', 'message': "Refactor: move base_iso handling from create_boot_iso

This is basically a no-op and does not belong there. Most of base_iso
handling happens in _prepare_iso_image, which has been restructured to
avoid redundant actions when boot_iso is provided.

Remove TODOs to rebuild base_iso. There are no immediate plans to
implement it, and I'm not even sure how doable it is (e.g. for CoreOS).

Change-Id: I9a0b955ec22d39b6a31494bd2593fec486f6d8a9
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor: move base_iso handling from create_boot_iso

This is basically a no-op and does not belong there. Most of base_iso
handling happens in _prepare_iso_image, which has been restructured to
avoid redundant actions when boot_iso is provided.

Remove TODOs to rebuild base_iso. There are no immediate plans to
implement it, and I'm not even sure how doable it is (e.g. for CoreOS).

Change-Id: I9a0b955ec22d39b6a31494bd2593fec486f6d8a9

[{'created': '2021-09-09 15:51:18.000000000', 'message': 'Replace "Inspector.from_engine()" with "sqlalchemy.inspect()"

Since SQLAlchemy 1.4, the method "Inspector.from_engine()" is
deprecated.

Error message:
"The from_engine() method on Inspector is deprecated and will be removed
in a future release.  Please use the sqlalchemy.inspect() function on an
Engine or Connection in order to acquire an Inspector. (deprecated
since: 1.4)"

Minimum version of SQLAlchemy required is bumped to 1.4.23.

Change-Id: I6cf5944ccb3a0532cbf123ddc0d7df6b6de80af1
Closes-Bug: #1943155

commit_message:
Replace "Inspector.from_engine()" with "sqlalchemy.inspect()"

Since SQLAlchemy 1.4, the method "Inspector.from_engine()" is
deprecated.

Error message:
"The from_engine() method on Inspector is deprecated and will be removed
in a future release.  Please use the sqlalchemy.inspect() function on an
Engine or Connection in order to acquire an Inspector. (deprecated
since: 1.4)"

Minimum version of SQLAlchemy required is bumped to 1.4.23.

Change-Id: I6cf5944ccb3a0532cbf123ddc0d7df6b6de80af1
Closes-Bug: #1943155

commit_message:
Revert "update subport status when trunk/subport create/delete is triggerred"

This reverts commit 101ccbaeb3c48d9757c276716098ee6e17e12fb8.

Reason for revert: This commit is probably reason of some race condition
which causes random failures in the test_trunk_subport_lifecycle scenario
test.

Change-Id: Ia042384e0ac333f30235b76e50fdc8748fc2b29a
Closes-Bug: #1943708
(cherry picked from commit b0e01c7df3a8f73f0997fc6125de2b2c78a45862)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-15 12:57:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add PublicTLSCAFile to docs

We should document the PublicTLSCAFile parameter since it
adds the cacert section in the clouds.yaml file. Without
this param, the cacert section is left empty.

Resolves: rhbz#1999872
Change-Id: Icbebf1adbeb43705bf8a9b05abcce9580fbea4e6
'}]
commit_message:
Add PublicTLSCAFile to docs

We should document the PublicTLSCAFile parameter since it
adds the cacert section in the clouds.yaml file. Without
this param, the cacert section is left empty.

Resolves: rhbz#1999872
Change-Id: Icbebf1adbeb43705bf8a9b05abcce9580fbea4e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-29 09:13:28.000000000', 'message': 'Stop configuring install_command in tox.

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: I49ee1edec05ec02c667e1e6bec6cb4c12112b682
Co-Authored-By: tushargite96 <tushargite96@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: I49ee1edec05ec02c667e1e6bec6cb4c12112b682
Co-Authored-By: tushargite96 <tushargite96@gmail.com>

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-10 00:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

As is mentioned in my inline comment, could you check whether a future libvirt package includes both the single libvirt service and the modular libvirt services ?
If so, we should make sure that the single service is stoppend when modular services are enabled.
If no, I think we can just skip all resources related to libvirt service.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-09-10 07:41:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

> Patch Set 20:
> 
> As is mentioned in my inline comment, could you check whether a future libvirt package includes both the single libvirt service and the modular libvirt services ?

just replying to this package question.

libvirtd and virtproxyd are provided in the same package
# rpm -qf /usr/sbin/virtproxyd /usr/sbin/libvirtd 
libvirt-daemon-6.6.0-13.2.module+el8.3.1+10483+85317cf0.x86_64
libvirt-daemon-6.6.0-13.2.module+el8.3.1+10483+85317cf0.x86_64

but other modular services are provided by different packages, e.g.:
# rpm -qf /usr/sbin/virtnodedevd 
libvirt-daemon-driver-nodedev-6.6.0-13.2.module+el8.3.1+10483+85317cf0.x86_64

# rpm -qf /usr/sbin/virtqemud 
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu-6.6.0-13.2.module+el8.3.1+10483+85317cf0.x86_64

# rpm -qf /usr/sbin/virtsecretd 
libvirt-daemon-driver-secret-6.6.0-13.2.module+el8.3.1+10483+85317cf0.x86_64

> If so, we should make sure that the single service is stoppend when modular services are enabled.

so yes we need to make sure libvirtd is disabled when virtproxyd gets enabled for modular services.

> If no, I think we can just skip all resources related to libvirt service.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-10 07:44:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

> Patch Set 20:
> 
> > Patch Set 20:
> > 
> > As is mentioned in my inline comment, could you check whether a future libvirt package includes both the single libvirt service and the modular libvirt services ?
> 
> just replying to this package question.
> 
> libvirtd and virtproxyd are provided in the same package
> # rpm -qf /usr/sbin/virtproxyd /usr/sbin/libvirtd 
> libvirt-daemon-6.6.0-13.2.module+el8.3.1+10483+85317cf0.x86_64
> libvirt-daemon-6.6.0-13.2.module+el8.3.1+10483+85317cf0.x86_64
> 
> but other modular services are provided by different packages, e.g.:
> # rpm -qf /usr/sbin/virtnodedevd 
> libvirt-daemon-driver-nodedev-6.6.0-13.2.module+el8.3.1+10483+85317cf0.x86_64
> 
> # rpm -qf /usr/sbin/virtqemud 
> libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu-6.6.0-13.2.module+el8.3.1+10483+85317cf0.x86_64
> 
> # rpm -qf /usr/sbin/virtsecretd 
> libvirt-daemon-driver-secret-6.6.0-13.2.module+el8.3.1+10483+85317cf0.x86_64
> 
> > If so, we should make sure that the single service is stoppend when modular services are enabled.
> 
> so yes we need to make sure libvirtd is disabled when virtproxyd gets enabled for modular services.
> 
> > If no, I think we can just skip all resources related to libvirt service.

Thanks Martion,

So it also implies that we also need to add package resources to install these different packages.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-10 07:45:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

Oops. sorry about my typo about your name :-('}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-09-10 07:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

commit_message:
Enable support for Libvirt modular daemons

This change enables support for modular libvirt
daemon configurations.

NOTE: As of now, this change doesn't handle any modular daemons
socket configuration.

Change-Id: I90c3dd7bd63f9f54e43eee7bc2f58d165ca80e57

'libvirt-daemon-system' in Ubuntu/Debian and current usage doesn't work

commit_message:
Fix how libvirt package resource is looked up

The package name is not always 'libvirt' and the current logic to find
the package resource using 'name' doesn't work properly. This change
ensures the resource is found by title, which is always 'libvirt'.

Change-Id: Ic26fd0ec9c745077abc82befe15fe0d477e34ce2

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: If49cb308a440a4cd18cc1688845b480f54dc6abd
